Memories Found information Requests and notes Nimble's flash drive Flamethrower for Prapor in Garbage Try to help Fang Somewhere around here Butterfingers lost a container with an artifact
The leader of the "Freedom" faction needs dynamite. With its help, they will blow up the blockage that prevents direct communication between the Freedom base territory and Foggy Thicket. According to Lukash, the dynamite should be with the scientists in the Swamp. Bootlegger said you need a reliable person? We need one. We have an entrance to a collector behind the headquarters building, not exactly a collector... well, it's a big pipe. From documents found here, we were able to establish that it's like an evacuation passage that leads far beyond the base, somewhere to Foggy Thicket. As you understand, a new route would be very handy for us, bypassing Duty territory. The problem is that this passage is heavily blocked and without a good directed explosion, there's no way to clear all this. And to organize an explosion of suitable power, we need dynamite. At least a crate. I heard that the nerds who settled in the Swamp have a supply of explosives. How about it, can you negotiate and bring some? You'll be able to use this passage yourself later. Alright, I'll try to get you some dynamite. No, dragging a crate of explosives halfway across the Zone - life didn't prepare me for that. I guarantee a good reward, you definitely won't be left empty-handed.
About the dynamite, I... Did you go? How did it turn out? Yes. Here, they gave it to me. Careful... Take it. I went, but didn't bring anything yet. Working on it. Well, thank you. Here, I'm sending you a waypoint on your PDA just in case, where the passage starts. I think when you visit us next time, we'll have finished clearing the blockage. And here's the promised reward. Thanks, see you soon.
I need explosives. What do I care what you need? Well, I didn't put it right. Someone says you can get explosives from you guys. Is that true or not? Hmm... People sure like to talk! Well, there's a little. Just in case... Not for sale! What am I supposed to do? I really, really need it. Surely there's some option? Well... There's one way. If you're not pressed for time, as they say... Our eggheads can't test one theory. About oversized broilers. They gave me their wish: whoever gets a piece from him, from the giant that is, gets honor and respect. Or, as in our case, dynamite and goodbye. I can give you a tip. Hunters said there's a local butcher in the Gut, calls himself Prosha. He might help you with this matter. Clear? Yeah! I happen to have one with me! Take it. A piece from a giant? I don't even know... Well... There's one way. If you're not pressed for time, as they say... Our eggheads can't test one theory. About how mutants like controllers came to be. They gave me their wish: whoever gets some genetic material from him, from a controller that is, gets honor and respect. Or, as in our case, dynamite and goodbye. I can give you a tip. Hunters said there's a local butcher in the Gut, calls himself Prosha. He might help you with this matter. Clear? Yeah! I happen to have one with me! Take it. A controller part? I don't even know... Well... There's one way. If you're not pressed for time, as they say... Our eggheads can't test one theory. About poltergeists. They gave me their wish: whoever gets their eye, from a poltergeist that is, gets honor and respect. Or, as in our case, dynamite and goodbye. I can give you a tip. Our guys said there's a local butcher in the Gut, calls himself Prosha. He might help you with this matter. Clear? Yeah! I happen to have one with me! Here. A poltergeist eye? I don't even know... Wow! Look how prepared you are, didn't expect that... Well, since we're having such a party, take the crate. Just don't strain yourself, drop it - your soul goes to heaven, and on earth there'll be just one dirty stain left. Handle it gently, like a maiden.
About that dynamite... We discussed it all already! Bring a piece of giant, then we can talk about explosives. Yep, I got a little piece the size of a cow's nostril. Here. Stubborn? Well, alright... Let's see. We discussed it all already! Bring a controller part, then we can talk about explosives. Yeah, I remember. Here. Got it. Had to work for it. Stubborn? Well, alright... Let's see. We discussed it all already! Bring a poltergeist eye, then we can talk about explosives. Well yes, yes. Here, look, the little eye is looking at you. Stubborn? Well, alright... Let's see. Wow! You're quite resourceful, didn't expect that... Well, since we're having such a party, take the crate. Just don't strain yourself, drop it - your soul goes to heaven, and on earth there'll be just one dirty stain left. Handle it gently, like a maiden.

Professor Sakharov, working in the bunker at Yantar, asked to bring him a third-level artifact in excellent condition, or a "Dummy" class artifact in any condition. After this, he will provide coordinates for a safe path to Red Forest through Yantar. At Bar they hinted about a safe route to Red Forest through these parts... Yes, there is such a route. But, as you say, it's tit for tat. We're currently preparing to conduct another series of experiments and urgently need additional anomalous samples. Bring us a 3rd level artifact, and I'll show you the way. But please, the artifact must be of excellent quality. So to speak, with minimal "wear". If you bring a dummy class artifact, I'll accept it in any condition. Well then, I'll try to find one.
About the route to Red Forest. Did you bring an artifact? Come on, come on... What do you have there? Will this one work? This one seems to be from the dummies. Will it do? Haven't gotten any suitable artifacts yet. Yes... just the thing, thank you.
Look, we checked... I'll show you on the map - here, behind the buildings of this factory complex, there's a safe path that leads straight to the so-called Red Forest. See? Yeah, thanks, professor! By the way, there is an alternative way to get to that territory from the area called Army Warehouses. I can see from your face that you didn't know about this. Mmm... as a sign of gratitude for your fruitful cooperation with our science department, I'll mark this passage for you completely free of charge. But I wouldn't recommend going there without good equipment. Very dangerous place.
If you do go there, I have a request. A group of our colleagues who went there last month disappeared, and we have no news from them at all. If you find their traces, please let me know. The uncertainty... you know, we're all worried here. Their base was in an old excavation, near the entrance to the nature preserve. And thanks again! Maybe there's something else to help science with? Dangerous? Probably need good weapons... That's at Agroprom, you'll have to deal with the military. There was a chance to get some good equipment there. But until I go back and forth... And I'll keep your request in mind. I have a request, just in case you decide to visit Red Forest. A group of our colleagues who went there last month disappeared, and we have no news from them at all. If you find their traces, please let me know. The uncertainty... you know, we're all worried here. Their base was in an old excavation, near the entrance to the nature preserve. But I wouldn't recommend going there without good equipment. Very dangerous place. You mean the Agroprom Research Institute? There's a safe path directly from us there. At least, soldiers used to come running here. We sometimes take their mail and forward it to the "mainland", and occasionally we even manage to organize telephone communication. I think I know one "soldier" who I can ask about this topic. See you later, prof! Right! I know about the short path from here to "Agroprom"... completely slipped my mind. 
They say there's a path from Agroprom to Yantar. Should ask the deserter Valuev about this.
Repairing stuff? Yeah, fixing things bit by bit. Here, bringing this Duty armor to decent condition. I can patch yours up too or replace the glass on a broken mask if needed. What you got there? Can't you see I'm busy? Don't bother me while I'm working, alright? We agreed that you'd find out how to refuel the flamethrower and tell me. Keep your word, then we can talk about repairs. We agreed that you'd get me a "Cobblestone" artifact. Remember? Keep your word, then we can talk about repairs. Well, you can see what condition my armor is in... Can you repair it? I need the glass replaced on my mask, and patch it up too... Right now I don't need anything fixed. Just asking for future reference. Okay, okay, stop whining. U-u-uh, I haven't found out yet... U-u-uh, haven't found one yet... Sure thing. I've had to fix worse stuff than this. You got the dough? Are you kidding? There are holes the size of a fist here... In short - these are rags, not a suit. Hmm. This is special leather. Flesh hide, if I'm not mistaken. They make especially durable coats from this, but only master leatherworkers can repair them. Seems like only Stepanych takes on such work in the Zone. I know he used to appear frequently in the Swamp, but now I have no idea where to look for him. Well I'll be... I can't understand what this surface is treated with?! Wow! The material seems familiar, but where does such durability come from? Nah, you know what, I probably won't take this on. I foresee too much hassle, waste of time. No problem. Let's see what we have here... Ah, there's about an hour's work here. But you'll have to leave the armor itself too. I'll need to check everything thoroughly. My services will cost you Well... expensive, of course, but I agree. Go ahead and repair it. Man, you really loaded up that price. I'm not ready for such expenses yet. I understand. I wasn't really hoping for much anyway. Should contact Stepanych then? Got it, thanks. Well, suit yourself... Expensive though... Alright, I'm flush with cash right now. Get to work. How much-how much? No, that's way too much... Already getting started. Just don't stand over my shoulder, alright? When it's ready, I'll let Garik, the guard, know. Deal.
How's the repair going? Ready? U-uh... did you bring something? There are many of you, but only one of me. Can't remember everything. What are you talking about? I just came by recently, asked you to replace the glass on my mask and fix it up in general... What are you talking about? I just came by recently, left my armor with you, come on, remember... Relax, I'm just joking. I have all transactions recorded. Work's done, take your suit. "The haircut has just begun." Ever see that old Soviet cartoon? Joker, damn. Alright, let's move on. Got the hint. Wait, did you see that the whole mask on this suit is broken? You need to replace the glass if you don't want to croak from breathing all kinds of poison at the Warehouses or Wild Territory. Wait, are you aware that this suit is full of holes and tears, which means it'll let poisonous atmosphere through? You need to patch it up if you don't want to croak from breathing all kinds of nastiness at the Warehouses or Wild Territory. Come on, why did you get all grumpy immediately? Stalkers have no sense of humor... Thanks for the warning. I'll think about it.
In payment for a service rendered earlier, I need to find and bring Lanky a "Cobblestone" artifact. About that deal of ours... Well? Did you bring it? Yeah, here's "Cobblestone", good artifact, lets you carry a lot... Not yet, but I know where to get one... I respect those who keep their word! Come by if you need anything.
In payment for a service rendered earlier, I need to learn from Freedomer Screw how to prepare special mixture for the flamethrower and tell Lanky about it. About that deal of ours... Well? Did you find out? Does Screw refuel it? How? Yeah, here he scribbled a note. Here, take a look. Hmm, I see. Separator? And where... Alright... I respect those who keep their word! Come by if you need anything.

Big greetings from Syak! Door codes Scouted routes

The "Ruby Battery" artifact can eliminate
%c[UI_orange]"Electra" %c[default]and %c[UI_orange]"Vortex" %c[default]anomalies.
 
%c[default]Time that the transformation lasts - %c[green]about two hours. 
 
If you throw the "Spring" artifact into the "Snow" anomaly, you can get a "Ruby Spring".
The "Ruby Spring" artifact can eliminate the
%c[UI_orange]"Whirlgig" %c[default]anomaly.
 
%c[default]Time after which a new artifact will appear - %c[green]about two hours.

The "Ruby Pellicle" artifact can eliminate the

%c[default]Won't have to wait long until it's ready... %c[green]About two hours. 
 
If you throw a fully positive "Stone Blood" artifact into the "Fruit Punch" anomaly in "Foggy Thicket", you can get its emerald variety...
 
Transformation takes... %c[green]an hour. 
 
If you throw a fully positive "Jellyfish" artifact into the "Fruit Punch" anomaly in "Foggy Thicket", you can get its emerald variety...
 
Transformation takes... %c[green]an hour. 
 
If you throw a fully positive "Wrenched" artifact into the "Fruit Punch" anomaly in "Foggy Thicket", you can get its emerald variety...
 
Transformation takes... %c[green]an hour. 
 
If you throw the "Dummy" artifact into the "Snow" anomaly, you can get an "Accumulator"...

To the Commander of the Defense Cordon Troops
Report
I hereby report: On 14.04.2012 at 22:00 during evening roll call, the absence of three servicemen from my unit stationed at the former "Agrokompleks" Research Institute was discovered. During questioning of the rest, the following facts were revealed: the missing servicemen repeatedly, taking advantage of lack of control from junior command staff, visited local trader Sidorovich, who supplied them with alcoholic beverages and narcotics.
According to their fellow servicemen, during patrol duty they discovered an unidentified passage to the Cordon through the "Forgotten Village" territory. The location and approach to this passage are provided on the attached map-diagram.
My undertaken measures to search for the missing servicemen have yielded no results. Information from the Guide:
Not far beyond the former farm, there's a possibility to reach the "Agroprom" Research Institute through the Forgotten Village. The scientist in the bunker, in gratitude for the case provided to him, pointed out a completely unknown path from the former "Agroprom" Research Institute to the research laboratory at Yantar. According to documents stolen from the military base at the "Agroprom" Research Institute, the military planned to penetrate deep into the Zone through a newly opened path, one section of which passes through the X-16 research center, located near the scientists' bunker at Yantar. Few know that beyond the railway depot of the "Rostok" factory begins a road by which you can reach the eastern edge of the "Red Forest". But only seasoned stalkers or truly dark individuals dare to walk there. And even then - not alone. There is a passage from the Army Warehouses to the Red Forest. Probably, the military once used it. Now mercenaries have settled at the passage. Why - it's unclear. In the documents from the laboratory, a path was marked from the X-16 research complex, located at Yantar, to the Red Forest. The scientist at the Ivankovsky District Center indicated the entrance to laboratory X-12. Presumably there you can activate the "Rainbow" emitter. Documents found on scientists. A transition from Radar to the "Tesla" zone is indicated. Rather dubious due to its inaccessibility. At the former bandit base in Dark Valley, in the basement of the construction site, you can get to laboratory X-10. Barkeep reported about a path.

Information about a passage from Dark Valley to Foggy Thicket has been discovered. The passage was rarely used and few knew about it. Something strange is there in that thicket, which is why stalkers so reluctantly go there. Members of the "Freedom" faction have recently begun actively using a new route from their camp at the Warehouses to Foggy Thicket. Now it's become much easier for them to penetrate other parts of the Zone bypassing "Duty" outposts. You can pass from the Cordon to "the Gut". Who named this place like that - unclear. But apparently it reflects the essence in the eyes of other stalkers - little useful, narrow and full of all kinds of infection. According to stories, the tangle of anomalies blocking the path to the "Freedom" base is not so impassable after all. Apparently the Duty guys always knew this, they just hide it from stalkers, since there are "anarchists" from "Freedom" there. But someone still tells about the passage, since you can learn about it. Information about the passage location to Wild Territory has been obtained. Most likely this passage was always there, only an anomaly blocked it, but now it's clear that you can bypass it, so... Should we consider this a reward? Probably yes! In this world the absence of information is like death... One of the first passages discovered by stalkers. This is also one of the most dangerous and at the same time frequently used paths. All stalkers use this passage, despite the dangers. One of the first passages discovered by stalkers. This is also one of the most dangerous and at the same time frequently used paths. All stalkers use this passage, despite the dangers. It turns out there is a passage between underground laboratories X-18 and X-16 from one to the other. This was to be expected, possibly even that all laboratories are connected to each other. The scientist at the Ivankovsky District Center told where the power supply console for the radar installations might be. It's somewhere in the laboratory under code X-12. You can exit from Foggy Thicket to the Garbage. The passage always existed, only few used it. Finding the entrance to the diggers' Underground, or simply the Cave, in Foggy Thicket is quite difficult - both the locality itself is unusual, and the place is painfully inconspicuous. It would be strange if this passage didn't exist, since it's the simplest and fastest way to get to Foggy Thicket when going through the Garbage from the Cordon. From the Army Warehouses there is a path to the "Tesla" zone. This path is known to few, because few have been to the "Tesla" zone. Or rather - only few returned alive. This passage has always existed and someone has always tried to control it - some or others, because it's a very convenient path and an easy opportunity to take bribes for passage. Now the passage is controlled by some bandits. Limansk itself is not very attractive to stalkers, however it serves as a convenient staging area for factions seeking to penetrate to the Zone's center. Therefore the passage from the city to the Warehouses is carefully guarded by Freedomers. Unknown from where, but every rookie almost immediately learns how to get to the Sanatorium. And although there's not much to profit from there, every greenhorn recruit considers it their duty to peek in there. It's something like a test of courage for them. Unknown from where, but every rookie almost immediately learns how to get to the Sanatorium. And although there's not much to profit from there, every greenhorn recruit considers it their duty to peek in there. It's something like a test of courage for them. The relatively safe path Garbage - Sanatorium was first scouted by marauders. And naturally they actively used it to carry out everything possible from the Sanatorium. But even now from time to time someone peeks into the Sanatorium, passing this way. This exit from the Cave to the Red Forest appeared recently. Who made it and why is no longer possible to find out, but this someone clearly didn't advertise their discovery, especially since the exit leads to such an impassable and dangerous part of the Zone. From the "Tesla" zone you can get to the District Center or, as stalkers also call it, the Dead City. This is quite close to the Zone's center, from there it's within arm's reach to Pripyat, if of course you can trust all these maps. Why stalkers don't rush there in that case, if there's a known road, remains unclear for now. That from the "Tesla" zone you can penetrate into a military laboratory, the entrance to which is located here, is not surprising at all. These two objects must have been connected. The military and scientists were cooking up something here and conducting some secret developments. It's just unclear why they abandoned everything and all suddenly left these places... Or maybe they didn't leave, but something happened? There is a passage from Limansk to the "Tesla" zone. Who needed to go there specifically from Limansk? "Tesla" is generally a dangerous place, and the presence of such an unprotected passage is also a danger to the local places. It's unknown what might crawl out from there... From the Forgotten Village it's quite simple to go to the Swamp. This path should probably be used by the military, since you can go straight through the village from the Swamp to Agroprom. And maybe someone else uses this road too - smugglers for example, why not - very convenient... From the Forgotten Village it's quite simple to go to the Swamp. This path should probably be used by the military, since you can go straight through the village from the Swamp to Agroprom. And maybe someone else uses this road too - smugglers for example, why not - very convenient... From the Garbage you can get directly to the Sanatorium. Stalkers sometimes carry junk to Lyoha Junkman this way. The "Clear Sky" group was once located at the Swamp. It turns out someone from them still remains in the Zone, though they said no one's been around for a long time. Maybe it will still be possible to meet someone... What happened to them, what were they looking for anyway and why did they organize a hunt for Strelok, even hired a mercenary? And then, what's this strange idea that some single stalker, even if it's Strelok, could disrupt some "balance" of the entire ZONE... and the Zone supposedly grows because of him. What nonsense. Although, if you think about it... Many wonders hide behind the mists... Why did Strelok want to get to the Zone's center? Somewhere there should be a hint or explanation. From the Swamp there is a direct and simple path to Agroprom. Stalkers don't like to use this road because they are inhospitably met by the military at Agroprom. But for the soldiers it's a regular route. Not far from the military base at Agroprom there is a convenient trail to the Swamp. Smugglers were the first to take a fancy to it, but often desperate stalkers also escape along it from military pursuit to the Swamp, where it's easy to hide in the reeds. The Forgotten Village turns out to be a very convenient place. You can easily get to the Garbage from there too. And if not for the presence of various creatures at the village, which crawl out from somewhere faster than they can be shot down, the Village could become a kind of domain for stalkers. But for now you can only meet a few dark individuals and a bunch of creatures there...
The only problem is that it radiates wildly on this path, better not go there without antirad... Of course, laboratories X-6 and X-8 are also connected to each other. Who would doubt it... What they were doing there and where everyone disappeared - a mystery shrouded in darkness. And this mystery will be revealed, apparently, very slowly, if anyone can learn anything at all. Strange that not everyone knows about this path. This is the old road south through the Gut. Sidorovich said where it's easiest to get from the Cordon to the Garbage. Bes told that bandits have settled at the passage to Agroprom and indicated the location of the passage. Prapor at the Garbage said that the direct road to the Bar leads through the "Duty" checkpoint. Prapor at the Garbage told about the path to Dark Valley. There is an inconspicuous exit from the Sanatorium that leads straight to the Gut. You can get to Yantar through Wild Territory. Not the simplest and fastest path, considering the abundance of monsters in Wild Territory. At the Army Warehouses beyond the Barrier you can go straight to Radar, and from there to the "Brain Scorcher". The scientist at the Ivankovsky District Center told how you can get to Pripyat. Barkeep marked the approximate location where the entrance to the "Brain Scorcher" control bunker at Radar might be.
Where and why do I need to go? One of the stalkers was bringing me an important document, won't say from where and from whom... Very close from here he got caught in an anomaly, stayed alive, but the document wasn't with him. He can't move around yet, I'd go myself but I can't leave the rookies alone... Find the document, I'll get you an assault rifle. It's in the underground passage under the railway, straight north...
And mind this, Marked One, my word here isn't the last one, refuse - it'll be hard for you to negotiate with the local folk... You get it? Not far in principle. I'll try to bring it. No, Wolf, I'm not going into anomalies. Just watch out - it's dangerous there... The courier was an experienced stalker, and look, he got caught. Be more careful. And here, have some food. It hurts to look at you.
I was in the passage under the railway, almost croaked. Yeah? I know you need brains there. Charging in head-on - you can get fried. What about our business? I found the document, this one? Yes-yes, that's the one. Take this assault rifle, it's old but it hardly jams. Also take this pistol, with a silencer. Sometimes it's better to do it quietly... when taking down some monster. Otherwise, the death scream will bring the whole area running.
If you need ammo, talk to Major Kuznetsov when he's in a good mood, he might help.
Oh, by the way, Sidorovich found a job for you here. Drop by his place. Says it's urgent.
Wolf, sorry... But... What? Well, speak up, why are you dragging it out? In short, I can't do it. There are constant electrical discharges in that tunnel. Uh-uh-uh! Alright... I'll try one more time to get those documents. Ah... I see, honestly I wasn't expecting it. What can you do, you're barely standing. Rest for now. I'll ask someone else or worst case - I'll go myself.
Oh, by the way, Sidorovich found a job for you here... Drop by his place. Says it's urgent.
I'm here about the documents from the tunnel. Documents? Ah! Yes-yes, but why you? I was... Oh right, okay. Where are the documents? Here's what was there, among the anomalies in the tunnel. Yes-yes, that's them... Take this assault rifle for your troubles, it's old though, and the spring in the magazine weakened, had to put a support under it. Fewer rounds will fit, but it hardly jams...
Come back later when you get settled, we'll talk about some other business... Oh yeah, beast of a machine...
Yesterday my boys spotted some stalker, but didn't grab him right away, instead followed him to see what he was up to. He was hanging around the "Fruit Punch" anomaly. So they took him out so he wouldn't be in the way, brought his PDA. Turns out he had a recipe written down on how to cook a "Fireball" in "Fruit Punch", that's why he was lurking there. Interesting, gotta try it.
Folder with scientific data. Some fragmentary notes and reflections about the Zone. ...So, about the intensity of the field. The fact that it changes, I don't even dispute; it's already visible from the measurement results. The point is how, by what law it changes. Is there periodicity, cyclicality or any kind of orderliness in these changes? If we can understand this, then we can possibly predict many other things - essentially we will approach some understanding of the Zone. So far, we've managed to predict an approaching emission with 51% probability. But an emission is a single and quite powerful surge; if we couldn't predict it with such probability, then we wouldn't be worth a penny at all. I'm talking about the general background level of the field and about islands with elevated levels...
 

...More on that later. I want to return to the possibility of predicting changes in the nature and intensity of the psi-field (you know, the term is quite conditional - a working name). Why is this so important? I'll try to explain. Here's what we typically deal with in the Zone: a) some sort of psi-field, b) anomalies, c) artifacts, d) monsters. At first glance, these all appear to be different things, but I believe they all belong to one category, but of a different order. Namely - all this can be referred to by one term: "anomalies". There is the Zone - a big anomaly, in it there is some field - an anomaly of the same order, but it does not go beyond the Zone's borders (although, no one has seriously considered this yet). Then there are actual anomalies - "Whirligig", "Carousel" and others, then there are artifacts born in these anomalies (so it's believed, at least), and finally monsters. I consider all of these to be different attributes of one anomaly...
 

...Perhaps all of this sounds confusing so far, but there must be feedback. I believe in this. Let's consider this again. So, the Zone (or something in it) generates a psi-field, which generates anomalies (this is conditional, maybe not the field itself, but its presence is mandatory), artifacts are born in anomalies, artifacts attract monsters. More or less. So what kind of feedback am I talking about? Here's what: if we were to remove all of the monsters, would artifacts show up? Why would they? Now let's remove artifacts - will anomalies be needed? Now, let's say, eliminate anomalies. Will this psi-field exist then? So, theoretically the Zone can be eliminated too. Yes, too far-fetched, I agree... But compared to the various silly theories about "superintelligence" and "contact", this one is no worse. Why not design experiments around this theory? Science often goes from experiment to theory. We can localize an area and gradually eliminate all monsters, collect and destroy all artifacts. This is within our power. And we'll see if the anomalies lose intensity? And we can even measure the intensity of the psi-field: what will happen to it after this? Will this somehow affect it? After all, there are already means of eliminating the anomalies themselves... So, now you understand what kind of experiment I'm talking about...
 

...Of course, we do not currently have the means nor resources for a large scale experiment of this nature. No one will undertake such an impossible task as destroying all monsters, zombies and artifacts, even within a confined area. But you can start small and conduct a local experiment with one specific anomaly. I'm talking about recently discovered so-called "variable" or "wandering" anomalies (this is again a working name). For example, I know that one can be found somewhere in the Radar territory, as well as in the "Tesla" zone. So, according to preliminary estimates, the intensity of such anomalies can change depending on whether some artifact is present nearby; that is, it is very "receptive" to this. Isn't this "feedback"? So far, we have gathered data that suggests such anomalies respond strongly to the "Pendulum" artifacts. But I suggest a pure experiment: we need to try different variants of artifacts and see how this anomaly responds to them; that is, if anomaly-artifact is a pair of symbionts, then the response will most likely be only to "Pendulums", but if it responds to other groups of artifacts too, then we can begin to draw conclusions about some sort of "feedback"...

Corporal Brome asked to find the debtor and convince him to return what's owed. 
Corporal Brome asked to bring him 10 bottles of vodka. 
Corporal Brome asked to bring him medicine for the "green serpent" that herbalist Boryan from the Swamp prepares.

General Voronin urgently needs a metal case with documents, which was lost in Dark Valley. What's in this case is unknown 
The case stolen from the military checkpoint contains encrypted data that only Barkeep's smart guy can decrypt 
Nut promised to tell about Ghost for two tanned flesh hides 
A drunk stalker in the Bar promised to tell something if I return his rifle that he lost to Baldy

Tolik asked to bring him five tails from blind dogs, he needs them for artifact transformation Why are you hesitating, want to ask something? Recently I met an experienced stalker, we shared a bottle with him, and he told me how you can get one artifact from another. From "Jellyfish" you can cook "Slime", can you imagine? For this you also need a tushkano head - I have that, a zombie hand - I traded for it, and a blind dog tail. That's the hard part. After my injury I'm not ready to chase dogs all over Cordon - it's hard. If you can bring me five tails, I'll share this method with you or give you some buckshot with medkits, not much, but I have a little stash. That's all! Look how many of those mutts are running around. Yeah, if only it was all so simple. This is the Zone. Hell knows what happens to these creatures. Either the dogs mutated, or their tails are weak by nature, and they later scrape them off somewhere in the bushes. You won't find a normal tail that's good for the job in every dog. That's why they're valuable. I see, that's how it is. I'll keep that in mind. Same problem with other creatures. Each has their own thing. For example, tushkano heads are valued, but getting one - that's a real problem! Seems like you shoot the body, but the head explodes! Some kind of pressure inside. Once I needed just one with a head, so I shot nearly all the tushkanos in Cordon before I got one like that. And now I need tails. I'll try to hunt some blind creatures. We'll talk about the reward later. No, I don't have time for that right now. Maybe later.
Hello. I brought you the tails... Well, Marked One, thank you. Take them before they start to stink... Where are they... Damn... I lost them! So what do you want, the recipe or some buckshot? I'm interested in recipes. Better buckshot, after chasing those dogs... Then look, I have it written down here, how to get "Slime"... Though I haven't tested it myself yet. Buckshot, it always comes in handy...
Take a couple medkits too as thanks.
So how are you doing, Petruha? Everything alright? Little by little... If I ask you about one thing, can you help? Help you? How's that? You already know about the Gut, right? Well, there's a passage north of ATP, hunters still guard it... Recently me and a buddy were getting ready for a trip. We were already set, and suddenly he urgently needed to go to the Gut. I was trying to talk him out of it, why go when everything's ready. He said he had to run an important errand, couldn't refuse. But there's no sign of him. So much time has passed. Maybe something happened... He couldn't have gone on a drinking binge. I would've gone looking myself, but I need to keep watch at ATP, in case the bandits show up again. You're suggesting I go there? Don't drop all your business for this, but if it's not too hard and you're heading that way - then look around. I don't think anything serious happened to him. Walk around there, ask the hunters if anyone's seen Vaaska? He has a distinctive rifle - TOZ, side-by-side, sixty-sixth. Not many people have those. Take a peek in any houses... buildings just in case. Maybe you'll find a trace. Could take a stroll, they say artifacts can be found there, and the area's scenic. I'll look for your Vaaska while I'm at it. Go look yourself! The ATP has others to guard it without you! I don't have time. I'll wait for news... any news!
Hello again, how's the situation? Seems quiet, but we're not losing vigilance... Didn't happen to go to the Gut?
I was thinking... can't find your buddy. The Gut is big, nobody there will say anything. Well still... Take a look there if it's on your way, maybe some trace. Damn... Alright. I'll walk around, take a look.
I was there. And looks like I found your buddy. Only... he's a corpse. At that village where I found him, bandits set up an ambush. Must've been hiding somewhere nearby when your Vaaska went into one of the houses, snuck in after him... and finished him off. Then they started waiting for the next victim, and they were so clever about laying low, I almost ended up next to your friend myself. Maybe it's not him? Wasn't there anything distinctive? He had a strange note on him. Here, look. Some numbers, abbreviations, BO, KK, NZ... some kind of cipher, right? At the end there's also a note about a rifle. Nothing. Judging by the look, he's been lying there a while. Ah... there was also a paper. Where did I put it?! Wait, I'll find it - bring it over. Oh yeah, oh yeah... It's him! His scrawl... Damn! I had a feeling! And whose errand he ran to do is also clear. And whose? What's this strange note? Nothing strange here... Ah, Marked One, even though it's not happy news, thanks anyway. And anyway: who ordered it and what's written - that's not important anymore. These aren't your problems... Take some buckshot, for the service. Well alright... Just curious.
Wanted to ask something else? And Vaaska's TOZ rifle didn't happen to turn up? No. I wasn't really looking for it there, honestly, just took a quick look around. Sketchy place, mutants wandering nearby. Found one rifle though, a real hunting piece. Hidden in the same house where Vaaska fell. Probably his... Ah, Vasyan... He bragged about his TOZ for so long. Give me this rifle, Marked One, eh? At least some memory of my friend will remain... I need this rifle myself. I did my job, see ya. If it's as a memory, then take it. Even though I liked it myself, but whatever... I'll find another one. Thank you! For this... I'll tell you a recipe. How to get a good artifact from a bad one or, if you want, I'll give you buckshot and a pistol, "Fort", new one. Magazine holds 12 regular PM rounds, sometimes those extra four rounds will save your life. What do you want? Recipes are tricky. Might work, might not. Better give me the pistol and some buckshot. Well come on, tell me the recipe. As you wish. Here you go.
And remember my friend. So here's how: you take "Jellyfish", "Wrenched", a boar hoof and a zombie hand... Don't laugh, I'm serious. You throw all this into the "Vortex" anomaly and in about ten minutes "Gravi" will be waiting for you. I did it myself, no kidding! Good. Now I'll be going, got business. 
Petruha asks to find his friend who went to the Gut and disappeared. Advised to talk with the local hunters and check the buildings
You mentioned getting an artifact? One of the local bandits, after heavy drinking, started bragging about how he'll get rich soon... That he can make some cooler artifact from "Jellyfish". If you find "Jellyfish", I'll share this information with you or give you five medkits. Let's try. Nah, I don't believe in this... It's solid info, I guarantee it. And why would I need your tooth?
Nimble, how are you? I found a "Jellyfish"... Excellent, let me try to pull off this artifact modification... Take it, and what about the reward? Later, I'll show this artifact to someone. I can share the recipe or give you medkits. I'm interested in recipes. Better give medkits, I was running around... The bandit said this: you need to throw "Jellyfish", "Thorn", a blind dog tail and a tushkano head into the "Whirligig" anomaly, what comes out is unknown, I didn't hear clearly, but something more useful - that's for sure! Medkits, they're always needed.
Thank you for your help, Marked One. I didn't thank you right away, now I've got a little something - accept it from the heart... 
Nimble wants to test the artifact modification method he heard from a bandit.
For this he needs the "Jellyfish" artifact
Bring vodka? How much? I've got an "anniversary" coming up... A round date, so to speak. I want to celebrate it properly. We've got plenty of snacks, but booze, as always - not enough.
So I don't have to run to the dealer again, maybe you can bring me five bottles. I'll have a small strategic reserve. Then you'll have something to gain too:
either ammo, or medicine, got good weapons. It's no trouble for me. I'll just run to Sidor. No-no-no, I'll be moving on. Then I'll wait.
Congratulations on your anniversary, comrade major. Don't shout, this ain't the parade ground. Did you bring it? Five bottles, as we agreed. Oh! Just a minute, I'll step away quickly. You helped me out... I'll remember you. Take three packs of rounds and a couple medkits, as extra.
If you feel like it, come by, maybe we'll make another deal. Thanks, can I pass through? You can pass through. Just watch out! I'm warning all stalkers - there's a special operation planned in Dark Valley. Sent a group from our battalion there, for reconnaissance and such. My friend Seryoga Lemeshko commands them - we studied together at the academy. Don't go there - got it?
If you don't need anything else, then get out of here. 
Major Kuznetsov can provide Kalash rounds, medicine or weapons. For this he needs five bottles of vodka.
What, always need medkits? Yeah, don't even mention it... Lately these blind dogs have mutated even more. A tiny scratch is enough - and you're done. So you have to disinfect immediately and cut out a whole chunk of infected flesh.
If you agree, I'll give you a recipe for ten medkits. Or something else valuable. I'll try to gather that many. Sorry, Fox, I need to keep moving. Thanks, friend. I'll be waiting.
Fox, I brought you 10 medkits as promised. Oh! Just in time. At least I'll recover a bit. Here you go, get well. Where did I put them? Did I drop them... Thanks for the help! I can give you a recipe for how to get "Fireball" from "Electra". Ah, no, actually I have the "Ball" itself. What will you take? If neither interests you, I can give you my old rifle. Though it needs cleaning and oiling, I stashed it a couple months ago when I got a better gun. It's been lying there all this time, but at least nobody stole it - checked it right before my last trip. Give me the recipe, I'll cook the "Ball" myself. Forget that cooking stuff. Give me the artifact. My gear is pretty mediocre right now, so your little rifle would come in handy, if it's good. I uploaded the recipe to your PDA. That's right. An artifact is more reliable. Good one. Saved me more than once. For long trips it's inconvenient to carry, but here, near the Zone borders - it's perfect!
Give me your PDA, I'll mark where to look for my stash with the rifle. Just keep in mind that these handhelds glitch sometimes. Happens that marks fall off the map. So try to at least roughly remember the important places. 
Fox needs medkits, no less than 10 pieces.
What kind of special gun did you mention? Where to find it? The stalker I went to the Bar with had a homemade submachine gun. Some craftsman built it for regular PM pistol rounds. Good round - expensive, but Soviet nine-millimeters... there's tons of them. And they're cheap. We came back from the Bar together, I wouldn't have gone alone. So I wasn't slacking, would've paid my debt next time. You're suggesting I take this homemade contraption from him?! Or am I missing something... No need to take anything from him. Here, in Garbage, across from the hangar, there's an old railway tunnel. That guy went in there for an artifact and never came back. Maybe died, and is still lying there. So go there yourself then. It's right nearby. After those troubles, my knees are still shaking. And going unarmed... Even though it's close, it's kinda scary somehow. In the tunnel, you say? Alright... but I'm not promising anything. Yeah, you're just one big walking trouble yourself. Crawl into your tunnel yourself. You try your best, I've got something to thank you with. 
Yurik, a novice from Garbage, asks to find a homemade submachine gun.
According to him, the stalker with this weapon died in the tunnel across from the hangar
And you stay healthy, Yurik. A favor? What favor? Come on! About the unusual weapon that stalker had who went into the tunnel. Don't you remember? Found your gun, tested it, nice little machine. Here you go... Haven't found your wonder-weapon yet, be patient... Yeah, with this thing I'm the king of Garbage! Can't feed you with thanks, let me upload a recipe to your PDA... or give you some ammo? I stashed a little bit... I'm interested in recipes. I'd rather have ammo. You'll cook a good artifact, use it.
Listen, Marked One, can I ask you for something else? Left of the road, there's an old bulldozer. Near it in a hollow there's a rusty pipe. I dumped some armor-piercing rounds there when I was running from those bastards. Use them.
Listen, Marked One, can I ask you for something else?
What a day... Everyone needs something. Alright, speak up... I just left Cordon recently, don't know how to do anything... Decided to prove to everyone that I'm worth something... But got unlucky, ran into bandits right away. It's shameful to return empty-handed, they'll laugh... If I had a part of some legendary monster... Burer paw, chimera claw, bloodsucker tentacles... or controller hand. Then I wouldn't have to hide my eyes in shame when I return to camp at Cordon. Maybe you'll find some?
And I'll tell you about an unusual artifact... well... actually, I only heard about it by accident... maybe I didn't hear everything properly. What demands you have, Yurik! If I get the chance, I'll bring it, but I'm not promising anything. Sorry, Yurik, you'll never become a real stalker this way. Get it yourself. Please try your best, Marked One. Otherwise I don't know how to return to camp.
So, Yurochka, need more monster parts? Yes! Of course! Do you have any? Catch the paw, great hunter... Here's bloodsucker tentacles, take them... Here's a chimera claw, you can brag about it... Controller hand, serious beast. Uh-uh-uh... Don't have any! Ah, now I'll walk around camp with a proud look, tell stories... About you, of course.
Yeah, about the artifact - I heard bandits talking to each other... Here, very close by, in a little forest behind the swamp, there's an old log. One of the brothers stuck some unusual artifact in there. Then zombies wandered in there, and dogs with tushkanos made a den nearby. That's why the bandits were afraid to go back to that place to get the artifact. They kept arguing about who would go. So it's probably still lying there... Watch it, Yurochka, if you lied... 
Yurik, a novice from Garbage, asks to bring him a monster part
You don't look so good, Max. Feeling unwell? In a way. Heard you took on treating our "old man" - Prapor, do us a favor too. You'd better not sit by the fire all day long, get off your ass and shoot some dogs and boars yourself... or whose tails and tentacles are you planning to treat each other with. By the way, where exactly are you going to apply them? Heh-heh. You misunderstood. I don't need monster parts. We're more inclined toward folk medicine. There's this healer at the Swamps - Boryan. He collects all kinds of medicinal herbs, makes tinctures and decoctions. Could you get three herb packets from him, the ones for stomach troubles? The food here gives us the runs often, might find us with bare asses under a bush someday. I can't leave myself, we're waiting for orders, going on a raid soon. Deal, I was heading that way anyway. But you'll owe me, keep that in mind. By the way, have you tried eating less junk? Switch to crackers and water, it'll ease up. We're almost on a diet as it is... 
Max Luber asks to bring three herb packets from Boryan, the healer at the Swamps.
The Duty guys from Garbage are asking for help. What happened to them? Someone got fever or something worse? Frequent stomach troubles from the food there. Diarrhea's been killing them. They shouldn't shove all kinds of junk in their mouths. I told Prapor long ago that "diversifying the menu" won't end well. That's understandable... Need three herb packets. The guys are preparing for a raid, they need to get treated. Then let's do this. Go to Pakhom, the supply guy at the scientists' base, and get six empty jars from him. Fill them with substance from the "Fruit Punch" anomaly, bring them to me. I'll have the preparations ready by then. Maybe the guys should just go on a diet, that might help? When you decide, come back. 
Boryan asks to bring six jars with "Fruit Punch" anomaly substance. For this he'll give herb collection for Luber and his team
Man, I ran around a lot with your jars. Well, if you brought them, let's have them. Intact? Take them, didn't break any. And here are the herbs for you. I wrote how and what to brew on a piece of paper. Put it inside so it doesn't get lost. And take some medicine, the road's not short, you never know. Thanks, I'm off.
Max, haven't crapped behind all the bushes yet? Don't be loud, Marked One... it's a delicate matter. Take your herbs, what and how to brew is written on the paper inside. Now we'll fix the digestion and can go on the raid. How should I thank you? I can give you a recipe for getting "Soul" artifact. Or maybe you'll take the artifact itself? I cooked one here, as a test. If Zone wonders don't interest you, I can offer something more down-to-earth - Soviet underbarrel grenade launcher "GP-25". Tell me the recipe. I'll test it myself. I'll take the artifact. No time to mess with cooking. Oh! Grenade launcher - just what I need. Write it down. Makes a good artifact. Take it, don't mind giving this one away. I'll throw in some rounds as a bonus. Do you even know how to use it? Well, not my business. Just be more careful with it.
What's wrong, brother, why so wrinkled up? You'd be wrinkled up here too! Leg won't bend, knee's swollen. Terrible pain. And the Doctor disappeared somewhere.
Damn. The last of my supplies will run out and what then... From Sidorovich, on credit, you can't even get snow in winter. You mean Swamp Doctor? He's not that far - across the bridge in a shack. Really?! Listen, friend, help me out. I'll sell you a couple grenades cheap. It's nothing for you to run to the Doctor, right? Tell him Kostik, nicknamed Butterfingers, asks for that ointment he gave before. He won't go unpaid, meaning I won't! Hmm. Won't run there specially, but if I meet him - I'll pass your request. By the way, why Butterfingers? You don't seem like a newbie in the Zone? Well... When I came here, I couldn't do almost anything. Couldn't make a fire, couldn't shoot, couldn't butcher a boar. I'm from the city. So the nickname stuck. And once it sticks - that's it, nobody remembers anything else. That's how it went. You too, now nobody will call you anything else - Marked One and that's it. Many carry nicknames that tell about their past...
How's it going, Kostik-butterfingers? How's the leg? Bad, damn... Haven't seen the Doctor? Saw him. And passed your request. Here's the result - a vial. Vial? Ah! Jar... I promised you grenades cheap? I'll give them for a thousand, deal? Alright, take your vial and the money. Hmm, I don't have a thousand... Well. Give what you have. But I'll only give one grenade. Agree, my leg really hurts. Agreed, take everything I have. Take the ointment... Thanks! Here are your grenades. I think they'll come in handy. Thanks! Here's your grenade. I think it'll come in handy.
There's a request, from Butterfingers. From Kostik? Still tramping around the Zone then. Troubles brought him here. He's too soft for such a place. What's wrong with him? His leg hurts, he says. Asks for medicine, like last time. I told him - go home. There's a hospital there, proper medicine. No! Stubborn. I'm not going back myself for now, waiting for someone. Will you take it? Here, just don't open it, the smell ain't great. Let him rub it for three days. Should help for a while. How are you yourself? Seems fine, I'm walking around... Butterfingers asked to go to Swamp Doctor and ask for leg ointment. Promised to sell a grenade cheap for this
Hello! Why so glum again? A hundred fifty for some cheer? I don't want any.
Listen, Marked One, I heard you were at Agroprom, right?
A stalker whispered to me that somewhere in the eastern block of the institute, some specialist stashed an unusual armor. Very durable, like steel.
I'd love to have one like that. In my rags, I'm afraid to even stick my nose out past the Cordon. Vergas says my jacket is only good for rags. I don't have money, and Sidorovich doesn't want to give credit because of that container incident.
You've already helped me out big time, I understand everything, but still... Won't you agree to look for that suit for me? Wow, that's something! Let me have some water, 'cause I'm so hungry there's no place to spend the night - just your case. Not at all! You misunderstood me, I'm not asking for a freebie. I'll share a good recipe in gratitude or pay with ammo - recently found a canister of alcohol behind the factory, hidden in the bushes, so I traded it with the military for a box of grenades.
Oh, and if my offer suits you and you manage to find the armor, there's one small request: please check that it's in good condition. I'm broke, as I said already. Can't afford repair costs if something happens. So, deal? Alright, you convinced me. I think I'll end up in those parts more than once, so I'll take a look when I get the chance, see if your armor is there. No, Kostik, the game's not worth the candle, as they say. And they probably told you bullshit, and you fell for it hook, line and sinker. Excellent! I knew from the moment we met that you're a stand-up guy, Marked One. To be honest, I didn't really believe it myself. Well... not meant to be, I guess.
Remember we talked about that sturdy armor? Yeah... What about it? Found it. Here you go. Don't be mad, but I don't have time to mess with this nonsense, ask someone else. Holy shit, Marked One! I didn't believe it. How can I thank you? I know a recipe for getting Stone Blood from Sparkler. Interested? Or want me to give you five F-1 grenades? Too bad you changed your mind. Don't even know who else to turn to... Let's see what we can get from Sparkler. Grenades are somehow more convenient than a recipe. Then I'll upload it to your PDA, and you can figure it out from there. Yeah, I think so too. Here you go. 
Butterfingers heard that someone hid an exceptionally durable stalker suit at Agroprom. He needs just such a suit to start making long-distance trips. Since he doesn't have money for possible repairs, he asks to check that the armor is in good condition. In return, he promises to share a valuable recipe or ammunition. However, you can always keep the find for yourself.
Why so glum? My health ain't good, either the local climate doesn't suit me or something else. Sometimes my back shoots such pain - I can't straighten up. The guys are laughing, but I'm not in the mood for jokes. An old stalker passed by recently - they call him Guide - haven't you met him? So he advised me. Make a tincture, he says, from flesh eyes, it'll take the pain away like magic. You bring me three... mmm, no, better make it four eyes, and I'll find something to thank you with. Flesh eyes? Alright, I'll get them. That's all bullshit. And I don't have time for this. Be a pal, get them.
How's your back? I'm getting around somehow, barely not riding a wheelbarrow. What's the deal with the eyes? Here they are, darlings, looking right at you. Haven't collected them yet, be patient. Thanks. You're still young and don't understand what a pain it is to guard the passage here with a bad back. So, I wrote down a recipe here for how to cook Slug, or maybe I can throw in some grenades? Give me the recipe, let's see what comes out. Grenades are needed, just have the right place to use them. Here's the paper with the recipe. If you can't cook it, come back later, maybe I'll help somehow. Take the grenades... Want to down a hundred grams?.. Alright, I see you're in a hurry. Take this too, a little present... fresh artifact. Stay healthy. Get well! 
Prapor, the Duty commander from Garbage, asks to get him four pseudoflesh eyes
What, the tincture didn't help? You look terrible... Hell knows. Maybe I need to drink something else. Bullet came by recently, he says there's an ointment that helps great. And it's made from bloodsucker tentacles. Maybe you'll take it on? Get a couple pieces, for testing? Then I'll share a recipe with you for how to get Flash from Sparkler, or I'll throw in some antirad, got a bit stocked up. Tentacles? I'll try. Sorry, commander, but I can't be bothered to run around the whole Zone after them. Try it, or I'll have no strength left with this disease.
How are you? I see you're in fighting shape. Only hope is in you, in that miraculous ointment. Take the tentacles, but in my opinion, you'll only make it worse. Sorry, I haven't got them yet. Can't get much worse, maybe it'll help. So how should I thank you? Share the recipe. Let's see what comes out. Antirad of course. I'll transfer information about converting Sparkler to Flash to your PDA. Take your antirad... and take an artifact too, since you refused the recipe. Get well. 
Prapor, the Duty commander from Garbage, asks to get him two bloodsucker tentacles
Good health to you... How are you? You know, the ointment helped... Now I need to keep it warm and everything will be fine. Knowledgeable people say that a belt made from pseudodog tails is the best way. Either radiation accumulates in them, or something else, but they warm you to the bone... Maybe you'll bring me five, and I'll get you a rare artifact - called Mama's beads? Or I'll throw in armor-piercing rounds for the Kalash, more than enough. What do you say? Those tails are a dime a dozen, I'll bring them, don't worry. Sorry, of course, but I'm not going to run around the whole Zone because of your back. That's excellent.
How's your lower back? I see you're in fighting shape... Aches a bit with the weather, asking for warmth... Here are your tails, for warming up... Tails are scarce. Hell knows why they fall apart. Now we'll make a belt and I'll be completely on the mend. Oh, yes, what do you want for the work? Give me the artifact, let's see what kind of "beads" these are. You promised rounds there... more than enough. Take it, take it... such artifacts are rarely found. I've got plenty of this stuff. Not a shame to give to a good man. Get well... Prapor, the Duty commander from Garbage, asks to get him five pseudodog tails
Maybe we can make a deal after all? I need to talk to your boss. Make a deal?! What do you take us for, cops?!
Although... There's one option.
When we last bailed out those wimp scientists in Dark Valley, I found an unusual artifact. We had to fight off a whole pack of local scum, so we were forced to get out of there... let's say, in a hurry. I dropped the artifact, can't really run with such a thing.
Since then, I can't get this damn thing out of my head, even dream about it at night. Maybe you'll find it and bring it? I'm sure it's still lying somewhere there. And then I'll let you into our base. In principle, I can try. And you say you're not cops... I'd better go talk to Barkeep. Then listen carefully where to look for the artifact. There's a swamp in the Valley, if you head south toward the Gut. We crossed the bridge over that swamp with the group, and immediately a herd of fleshes attacked us. Had to run. I dropped the backpack with the artifact so it wouldn't get in the way. Should be lying somewhere there, under the bridge. Then listen carefully where to look for the artifact. There's a swamp in the Valley, if you head south toward the Gut. In its western part there's an islet, with wooden planks leading to it, now long collapsed. So we were walking that day with the group along the edge of the swamp, near the planks. The fog was so thick you could cut it with an axe. That's when blind dogs and fleshes jumped us, and then cats showed up too. Had to run. Somewhere in that area I dropped the backpack with the artifact. Then listen carefully where to look for the artifact. There's a swamp in the Valley, if you head south toward the Gut. In its eastern part there's an islet, with wooden planks leading to it. So we were walking that day with the group along the edge of the swamp, near the planks. The fog was so thick you could cut it with an axe. Suddenly flame bursts started appearing from all sides - a burner anomaly spinning nearby, obviously. Had to run fast. Somewhere in that area I dropped the backpack with the artifact. Pretty vague, but I'll try to find it. See you.
Hey there, sergeant. Why are your eyes so red? Sleeping badly... Every night I see that artifact, like it's real. Found the cause of your restless sleep, here you go. Should drink about two hundred grams, then you'd sleep normally. Grateful to the grave. What a strange thing, damn it.
Here's a present for you too, think it'll come in handy.
You can pass, friend. 
Sergeant Plichko, head of Duty territory security, dropped a backpack with an unusual artifact in Dark Valley, somewhere in the swamp area. If I bring him this artifact, Plichko promises to let me into the Duty base
I'm about that unusual artifact. Hmm. I already paid you for it, what else? A grand. One thousand bucks. Cash or check, for that amount. Here's the thing, turns out this artifact is really needed for a job. Maybe you'll sell it to me? Se-e-ell...
Ah! Alright. Agreed! A grand and it's yours. Holy shit! Where am I gonna get you that kind of money? Here's your money. A grand! By check. Well, that's your problem... Go to Barkeep, he'll exchange your wooden ones for real ones. Well, it's a deal! Here's the artifact. Even though I wanted to sell it later on the mainland, but since a good man needs it...
Listen, warrior, aren't you tired of hanging around here? How much longer are you gonna sit on your ass and beg food from random stalkers? Where can I go? I want to get to the mainland, but that option is closed to me. Judge for yourself, I, as they say in official language, went AWOL from my post. They'll arrest me outside the perimeter immediately. I need to somehow justify my escape. And I can only do that if I prove I fled because I didn't want to carry out criminal orders from command. Take those same catacombs - they drove us there like cattle to slaughter. Sanya and I are probably the only ones who survived there...
All important papers, including written orders, are stored on the second floor of the main building, in a metal safe. Only the commander knows the code, and possibly his deputy, our warrant officer. If you could somehow get order "No... from...", then I could get out of here. Marked One, I'm begging you - help! In gratitude... I don't even know what to offer you?! I have a scope for domestic weapons, snatched it from the armory when I was running. I heard optics aren't easy to get in the Zone. So, what do you say? I definitely won't climb into the base, but I have a better idea. Seems to me it'll be easier to make a deal with your warrant officer than to play Rambo. Have you completely lost your mind? No, kid, better stick to stalking and forget about these orders. You're my only hope...
Hello, soldier. Got news. What? Everything bad? Good or bad - time will tell. For now, here's what I promised. Congrats on your discharge... soldier! Yeah, nothing good. Couldn't get the order yet. Don't despair, I'll think of something. Well, Marked One, I owe you my life now!
Here's the scope, as promised. Hope it comes in handy. And some medkits too, here, take a few.
We probably won't see each other again. So - farewell! Well, Marked One, I owe you my life now!
Here's the scope, as promised. Hope it comes in handy.
We probably won't see each other again. So - farewell! 
The Deserter asks to get him an "illegal" order, according to which he and other soldiers were sent to certain death in the catacombs under the institute. According to the deserter, the folder with orders is stored in a metal safe, on the second floor of the central building of Agroprom Research Institute. Only the commander knows the safe code, and possibly his deputy, the warrant officer.
Wolf, what are you doing here? Hello, Marked One. Just keeping an eye on things here. You never know. All sorts of crap might come through the Barrier, and these Freedomers are passed out... We'll try to call for backup from Bar then...
Tolik, the bastard, disappeared somewhere with the radio station...
You know that only army tube radios can work properly in these anomalies...
Maybe you can find out about Tolik? I can throw you some grenades for the underbarrel launcher for the favor, got some here, or get you a good artifact. Alright, I'll look for the poor guy. I think Tolik will show up himself soon...
About that Tolik... What happened to him? Where's the radio? Yeah, I need to find out, maybe he showed up himself. Here's the radio, take it. And Tolik, the coward, as soon as he saw a bloodsucker, he ran so fast that half the Zone thought an emission started... Ha, that's why I see emissions happening more often... So what do you want - grenades or an artifact? Give me grenades. A good artifact never hurts. Hold out your backpack, I'll fill it up generously. The gratitude ain't much... here's an artifact, been saving it for myself!
Tolik! Why are you sitting around like it's your birthday! Wolf's waiting for you with the radio at the Warehouses! So many commanders around... I can say I almost lost my life! Yeah. On the way, two, no, four bloodsuckers attacked me! I took down three, but ran out of ammo and my knife broke... Barely got out alive. Now I'm fixing my nerves with vodka, want three hundred grams? Well, Tolik... Where's the radio? Yeah, somewhere there, behind the hangar at Garbage there's a trench with pipes lying around... Probably lying there, if the bloodsuckers didn't take it for themselves... hic... excuse me... Wolf is monitoring the Barrier, and needs a radio station to ensure uninterrupted communication. Tolik was supposed to bring him this radio station, but nothing is known about him. Need to find Tolik and deliver the radio station to Wolf
I dropped by your guys at the Barrier. Respect to the men, nothing to say, they're busy with important business. Maybe some help is needed? Oh! It's you, Marked One, arrived just in time. We're running short on ammo for NATO weapons. Sidorovich promised to throw in a crate or two, but need to find a courier to him. I prepared a rare artifact for him - let him sell it, and give us ammo. Will you go? Information flows to me from all sides, got several unusual recipes... if you're interested, I'll share. Can thank you with goods and throw in some cash. No problem. I was just heading that way. No, no time now. Maybe later. Take the container. Just remember - one foot here, the other... You know where the other is. 
Bootlegger asks to take a container with a rare artifact to Sidorovich as payment for a crate of ammunition.
Did they deliver the ammo from Sidorovich? Yeah, they hauled in two whole crates. Should be enough for the near future. As I understand, there should be something else? He sent you a barrel of wine as a gift. So take it. That's perfect timing. Important guests will visit Lukash in the coming days. There'll be something to treat them with. It's all vodka and vodka, but here's some wine. Connoisseurs say that downing some Madeira after a hearty meal is just the thing.
Yes, what about you? Give me your PDA, I'll transfer the promised recipe. If you're interested... No? Then I'll pour you some ammo and give you some rubles. I'm interested in recipes. Give me ammo and cash. Write it down... If you're interested, I have other recipes too... So, come by. 
Yes! By the way! Since you're so reliable: our Lukash is looking for a trustworthy person to pull off a job. I think you won't be at a loss. Talk to him. Hold out your cap... and rubles to your account. If you're interested, I have other work too. So, come by. 
Yes! By the way! Since you're so reliable: our Lukash is looking for a trustworthy person to pull off a job. I think you won't be at a loss. Talk to him.
Bootlegger sent you a rare artifact. What? What kind of artifact? Can't eat in peace! You just sit there, stuffed your face - you're too fat to ride a tank. Don't know what artifact, it's sealed in a crate. He's asking for ammo. Get rid of the worms - and you'll have the same... Ah! I remember! I already sent people with the crates. He contacted me on the radio, said a courier would bring the artifact. So that's you? Me, who else. Take the container, barely made it here. One good thing is at least I don't have to drag anything back. Everyone badmouths old Sidorovich. But look how he takes care of you. Still gotta take something back though. A barrel of good wine. Promised it long ago. Just hurry up, Bootlegger's waiting.
I'm free for now, maybe you need something? Got time? Hmm...
There's a small job available. From informed people there's information that a group of young scientists, those who work for the military, conducted experiments with the Cobblestone artifact, researched the applicability of its anti-gravity properties. The work wasn't finished, they were lured to America. But they managed to make two experimental suits with anti-gravity effect. As usual with the military, nobody remembered these suits, threw them away and forgot. Will you take on getting them? Just let's do it this way - if you take it on, I need an artifact from you for the tip. Second level. You understand yourself - things like these suits, anyone would grab with both hands. Alright, here's your artifact. And where exactly? Don't feel like dealing with the military... Need to think about it. Heh-heh... In Karaganda... Sidorovich was chatting that they left them at the checkpoint, at the Cordon. A soldier there told him that something similar was lying around in the barracks attic. If, of course, nobody grabbed them yet. I've got a scheme here, how to safely approach the checkpoint if needed. Here, take it. Think faster, or I'll offer it to someone else.
Found those gravity suits from the soldiers... Gravity suits? What kind? Ah! You mean those with anti-gravity? Good work! So what do they do? Let you lift almost two hundred kilos, but they're heavy themselves... Take them. What do they do? A lot of things! I'll keep them for myself. Holy shit! I'll sell them to one guy, he was very interested. So what do you want - should I give you the recipe or can I hook you up with an excellent artifact, completely green? Give me the recipe, I'm interested in them. I'll take the artifact. Listen, how about you just give me one suit and that's it. What do you need both for? Then write it down. That's right. Alright, let it be so. It seems fair enough. What a guy you are, bro! Well alright, you took them, it's your call.

Bootlegger told me where to try to get a couple of unique suits that have an anti-gravity effect. Even sketched out a scheme. For details, should contact Sidorovich
Sidorovich - got a question for you. I'm in a good mood today... ask away. Bootlegger hinted that some soldier from the checkpoint told you about some unique suits. That they're lying around unattended somewhere. Maybe he did tell me. What's it to you about these suits? Bootlegger came to his senses! Those suits are long gone. I promised Bootlegger to get them. But, you understand, doing it quietly is complicated, and I don't want to go to war with the checkpoint. You made the right decision. Messing with soldiers - costs you more, and me too. There's an option to resolve this quietly. At night a soldier comes out to the concrete slabs. Runs a little business with stalkers for vodka. You could approach him, ask around, maybe find something out. You can also take some vodka from me... for a more candid conversation. Heh-heh. Thanks for the advice. Just a waste giving away that artifact.
Who else can I help out? You know Bes, the commander of the neutral squad at Garbage? His squad completely ran out of ammo, and I found a box of ammunition in a bandit stash. Will you take it to Bes? Just keep in mind - the box is heavy. I'm not weak either, I'll help the stalkers out. I need to look for the laboratory. Help the guys out. They'll be grateful.
Bullet sent you some ammo. Bullet? A Duty guy? Strange, you can't get snow from Duty in winter, and here's a box of ammo. Or am I missing something? He says he wants to organize stalkers to clean this place of bandits. Says all hope is on Bes. So take the box and we should settle up. Ah! I get it. They want to fight with other people's hands.
Wow, AK rounds. Good job you and Bullet. Recently I learned a recipe for getting a good artifact - "Night Star" from "Vortex". Want me to write it down? Or I can offer a curious carbine, called "Hammer OP-SKS". Yesterday we took it from one local thug. He loved arranging drunk shooting at night, you understand... A recipe? Let me write it down. You don't happen to have the artifact itself? I'd take it. A good gun never hurts. I'll send it to your PDA, it's more reliable.
Well then. Now let's spread the word, this scum is already stuck in many people's throats. If we gather enough decent guys, we'll try to crush this Borov's viper nest. I happen to have one. Here, take it.
Well then. Now let's spread the word, this scum is already stuck in many people's throats. If we gather enough decent guys, we'll try to crush this viper nest. You're thinking right, friend. I'm sure it'll serve you well.
Well then. Now let's spread the word, this scum is already stuck in many people's throats. If we gather enough decent guys, we'll try to crush this Borov's viper nest. Thanks for the hookup, but I doubt anyone will respond to your call. Same story was at Garbage... Bullet asks to bring ammunition from the caravan to Bes, commander of the neutral squad from Garbage (he went to Dark Valley, it seems). Ammunition should be looked for in the ravine behind the gas station
So what are you still doing here? You were going to lead the squad to the Valley. We're low on ammo. Bandits took my PDA, and it has coordinates to an ammunition stash recorded. The data is encrypted, so I think these scumbags won't understand what it is. I managed to turn on the marker, if there's a chance, try to track it. Docent at the Bar can find it. Then we'll have a chance to destroy this snake nest. And you'll get some benefit too. Interesting information. Well, I'll try. I need to look for the laboratory. I'm counting on you.
I found your PDA. Excellent, now we can start gathering the squad. Is the information undamaged? See for yourself. Well, your computer is trashed, crushed. So... Everything seems to be fine! Yeah, and there are coordinates. I think you have the right to know about this too.
In Foggy Thicket mercenaries abandoned several boxes. They seemed to want to make a transit warehouse there or there was an order from someone - not exactly known. But strange things are happening there, so their nerves couldn't take it - they bolted in a hurry. According to our data, here it is, near the old quarry. When you're there, you can use it, if there's still something there of course... Return Max Luber's PDA.
This PDA contains encrypted information about the location where ammunition is hidden. The bandit with this PDA could be anywhere. Better ask the smart guy from the Bar - Docent - to track the marker signal
I wouldn't mind earning some money. Got any jobs? I don't know about earnings, but I got hooked up with a new recipe. Specifically, how to get "Gravi" from "Wrenched". You're interested, right? Well, let's discuss it. Sorry, right now I'm not interested in this. Some other time. Heard about Fang? What a master craftsman he was. There's information that someone got unusual weapon. A prototype, experimental sample, made, according to rumors, by Fang himself as a unique piece. How this person got it - I don't know. And it's not really important. Maybe Fang personally gave it, or he stole it, or found something lost.
They gave me a tip where this weapon was later hidden by its new owner. Maybe it's bullshit, but... Will you check? In Dark Valley, to the left of the factory gates, there's a trailer, with an iron structure. Somewhere there it's worth looking for a backpack. Let's say. But why was? Got it. I'll try to find it. But he died. Long ago it seems. At least, those are the rumors going around.
Alright, to business. There's information that Fang made some unusual weapon to order. An experimental sample, a prototype, if you will. We should try to find this wunderwaffe. As far as I know, it exists as a unique piece, but surely from this sample we could churn out as many as we want. How to find it? Where? Ask Fang, who, by your own words, died long ago? Or do you suggest plowing through the entire Zone with your nose? Where did you even learn about this weapon? Fang used to show up at Bar from time to time. He was looking for various parts, asking Docent, asking Barkeep. He showed them drawings, blueprints, explained what exactly he needed. During his last appearance, he mentioned to our Prapor that he managed to assemble a new weapon. It shoots like hell, but still needs serious refinement. Like a demonstration model. At that moment he wasn't planning to hand this gun over to the client, which means he must have stashed it somewhere. Prapor knows Fang well, or what? Maybe he knows about his stashes too? No, he doesn't. In the Zone, it happens that a person seems to have many acquaintances and buddies. But only until it comes to loot. So, nobody tries to blab too much even to seemingly the best friends. Prapor is here, somewhere in Bar. You should ask him about Fang yourself. He seemed like a rather grim and unfriendly type to me. I doubt I'll be able to get anything out of him. At least try. If you can't find out what you need directly, then go the roundabout way: through connections and contacts, places he used to frequent, and so on...
You're looking for Strelok, and Fang, by the way, was one of his subordinates. This could also be a thread for the search. Extra motivation for you, and assurance for me that you won't forget about this assignment. Hmm... In my opinion, in this light your assignment is worth more than just one recipe. Something more substantial. You haven't even started yet, and you're already bargaining. We'll see. If I only get information from you, then don't expect more from me. But if you get the weapon, I guarantee a bonus. I'm not going to pressure you or rush you, but while wandering around the Zone, keep in mind that Petrenko asked you about something. Alright then. I'll keep it in mind.
Greetings! I got the gun we talked about! So you found it... Complications? None really, except that... had to do some running. Well then. Duty won't remain in debt. Here, take this detector, an improved model. It identifies almost all types of anomalies, even that damn "Witch's Jelly". It's not mass-produced, there are only a few of these in the Zone. Don't even ask where I got it from.
Yes, and that's not all! Give me your communication code, I'll send you an artifact transformation method... 
There is information that Fang made an unusual weapon. Petrenko asks to find it and bring it to him.
Messages have been circulating on the net that you might have work for a stalker. It happens... sometimes. I want to test one theory. I learned a new recipe, but haven't tried it yet. You can get "Moonlight" from "Flash". Only I don't have "Flash". Bring me two artifacts right away, in case something goes wrong, and I'll either share the recipe with you or throw in some grenades for the underbarrel launcher. There are plenty of these "Flash" artifacts, I'll bring them right now. Sorry, some other time. Plenty like dirt, you say? Yeah, right. Anyway, I'm waiting for two artifacts from you.
