About the "Flash" artifacts. Found them?! You're fast as diarrhea. That's a joke. I didn't think anyone would be ready to give up artifacts for a trivial set of words. Take them already, joker. Hmm... Indeed. Then I'll keep them for myself. So what do you want - should I send you the recipe or give you grenades. I need the recipe. It's interesting to see what will come out. I'll take the grenades, they're more reliable. Then write down the recipe.
For your speed - you get a bonus. Write it down or just remember: you can get a rare artifact from an ordinary "Pellicle", for this you need to throw it into "Snow", and "Ruby Pellicle" allows you to remove a "Springboard" anomaly from your path.
Since you're so responsible, maybe we can pull off one more job? Come back in a bit. We'll talk. Grenades, so grenades... take some RGDs too. I always have plenty of them, as you put it - "like dirt". Open your backpack.
And for your speed - you get a bonus. Write it down or just remember: you can get a rare artifact from an ordinary "Pellicle", for this you need to throw it into "Snow", and "Ruby Pellicle" allows you to remove a "Springboard" anomaly from your path.
Since you're so responsible, maybe we can pull off one more job? Come back in a bit. We'll talk. 
Petrenko asks to find him two "Flash" artifacts

Ivar needs a scientific suit. You should search in the northern part of Red Forest, at Radar
Hey there, tough mug... Got a good artifact for ya here. Where from? What kind of artifact? One scientist from Yantar handed it over, says you're in the know Ahhh... That one... Take it, here's his payment. Scientists are the same profiteers as everyone else.
Yeah right! I already went to that underground place, and you... Our job isn't to run around in underground places. We work more with our heads.
Marked One, did you see a decoder in the laboratory? What decoder? Sakharov gave Ghost a new model of transdecoder with triangulation function of disturbing influence of variable-wave gradient of psi-influence... What?! Did you even understand what you just said? In general, a small box with numbers, when Ghost last made contact, he said he was near the main shutdown console. Take a look there, if you bring it, I'll share with you a recipe for transforming "Gravi" into "Goldfish". You're suggesting I do measurements again and look for artifacts just for this? No way! No measurements needed anymore. There's no radiation there now... well, almost none - a safe level for health. Professor says the modulation has changed, and in this phase it will take at least several days before the radiation becomes deadly again. And what do artifacts have to do with it? You got out somehow, surely there are other entrances and exits there. Why didn't you say right away that such a safe modulation could happen? Maybe I didn't need to measure anything then? You were clicking switches there yourself - that's what changed something! And if you hadn't made the measurements, you wouldn't have been able to get inside. Listen, what's the difference now, I'm telling you - it's not dangerous there for now, but how long it will stay that way is unclear. So what? About the little device? What does it at least look like? A small box like that. I don't need the device itself as much as the flash card that's in it. The device too, of course, but all the information is recorded on the card. What did you say - flash card? You reminded me of something. What do you think, can you read what's recorded on a flash drive if it's been lying around somewhere for a very long time? Doesn't part of the information get erased? Probably, what could happen to it? So will you go and look for it? Maybe it's clean there now. I'll try to enter from another way somehow.
I found your little device. This one? Yes, that's the one! Take it. Thanks from all our science. You want the recipe or what? Tell me, let's see the result. I'd rather take the artifact itself than mess around with this witchcraft. Write down the recipe.
There's one more thing... won't you take a walk to Sidorovich? The artifact is so-so, of course. Take some special medical kits too. Stalkers value them!
There's one more thing... won't you take a walk to Sidorovich? 
Semyonov is looking for a lost decoder. According to him, the decoder might be located in laboratory X-16 near the main control console
To Sidorovich? Why? I understand you're not much of a talker. You see, I'm sitting on a bare salary. Sakharov doesn't spoil us much. But recently I found an artifact with unusual properties. I contacted Sidorovich, he agreed to pay a tidy sum. I need to deliver a container with the artifact to him, and get payment from him for me. It's become known around the Zone that you're not greedy for money, more interested in unusual things, so I'll show you a recipe on how to cook "Kolobok". Alright, I'll support our native science. Nah, guys, handle your own little business yourselves. Then it's a deal. Safe travels.
Hello... businessman. Well, how did it go? Everything alright? Fine, here's your money. Thanks, if you need anything, always feel free to ask. You want the recipe or will you take the artifact? I have one, though it's slightly spoiled. Tell me the recipe. I'll cook a fresh one. Just give me what you have. Then write it down and take some medicine. Take your artifact and some medicine. 
Sakharov's assistant wants to make some money. Deliver a unique artifact to Sidorovich and return with payment
Professor, it's written all over your face that you want to ask me about something. Spit it out already. Yes-yes, I was just about to... As I understand it, you managed to visit the underground laboratory indexed X-18, didn't you?
Could you go down there again and thoroughly examine everything for any documentation? As far as I know, several attempts were made to evacuate equipment and documents from that place. Therefore, surely everything valuable was prepared for evacuation and packed in some boxes or crates. Those are what you should definitely check.
The more papers you bring, the more substantial the reward will be. If something particularly valuable turns up among what you deliver, I promise an additional bonus from me personally. How do these terms sound to you? Will you take it on? Well... I'll try, but I'm not promising anything. Sorry, but I don't have time to deal with this right now.
I'm here about the documents from laboratory X-18. Well, speak up. Did you manage to find anything? I did. Take it. This is what I found. I'll probably take another look later. Haven't examined everything thoroughly yet. Alright, let's take a look. First I'll credit your account, just a minute... That's nice, thanks. But what's in the documents, professor? I'm curious myself. Now let me see... Guard log... Accounting statements... Work orders...
Nothing interesting so far. Pity. I was hoping for more. Maybe you could try searching better? Yeah, damn it... Fine. I'll make another attempt. No, professor. I don't want to deal with this anymore. Unfortunate. Well then... we'll have to ask someone else. Now let me see... Guard log... Accounting statements... Work orders...
And what's this? Experiment reports... Aha! What I was looking for! That is, I mean to say... We're incredibly lucky! I didn't even hope to get my hands on... Ahem, well, never mind.
Marked One, you've certainly earned additional reward! Please, accept this as a sign of my deepest gratitude and also... copy into your PDA a method for obtaining a most curious artifact with the working name "Medusa Gorgona". Do you know what its specialty is? You've surely encountered mutants in the Zone that are commonly called just cats here? Haven't you wondered how they manage to induce drowsiness in people? It's not really their purring. The sounds they make merely help tune their brain biorhythms for psi-wave attack... However, let me skip the unnecessary details and get to the point: this artifact blocks the psi-activity of these creatures. In my opinion, quite a useful property for stalker trade. 
Sakharov asks to revisit laboratory X-18 in search of any documents not evacuated from there during the evacuation. You should search in boxes or crates. The more you manage to find, the higher the reward will be.
Depends on what kind of job. Need to deliver something to Yantar.
Sakharov has several exoskeletons, I arranged with him to trade a couple for a rare artifact. The artifact is in a heavy protective container. Will you take it on? Not far, in principle, I'll make the trip. Not now, find another courier. Take the container. That's it, you're free to go. 
Petrenko is trading a rare artifact for two exoskeletons from Sakharov. Asks to work as a courier.
Yes, I'm just back from Sakharov. And where are the exoskeletons? Here, barely managed to carry them. Couldn't drag both at once, wait a bit, they'll be here soon. On behalf of Duty, I express my gratitude to you, Marked One. You'll be recommended for commendation.
Good evening, professor, I'm here by arrangement with Petrenko. Mm... unusual artifact, right? Exactly. Petrenko says there haven't been any like this before. Yes, judging by the description - a small sensation! I promised him new exoskeletons for his brotherhood, take them. Their power system isn't activated, but Petrenko knows how and what to connect.
Hello there, soldier, why are you frowning? Listen, you travel around a lot, maybe you'll find me one thing? What thing? And what's in it for me? I know about a good stash at Garbage. If we make a deal, I'll describe where it is. Or I can swap your vest for a normal, military one. The one you have on, you'd only take hunting... And even then, not for every "beast". But it can be put to use.
And the thing... I need a magazine, "Playboy". Don't think it's because of the chicks... There's just one recipe written in there, I really need it. The other day I sat with Baldy, got a little tired from vodka, it happens. I woke up in the morning, and the magazine was gone... I only remember that I was praising the chicks from there to the whole Bar. Someone must have swiped it... for pleasure, I guess. There are three charming brunettes on the cover. So what do you say? I know about a good stash at Garbage. If we make a deal, I'll describe where it is.
And the thing... I need a magazine, "Playboy". Don't think it's because of the chicks... There's just one recipe written in there, I really need it. The other day I sat with Baldy, got a little tired from vodka, it happens. I woke up in the morning, and the magazine was gone... I only remember that I was praising the chicks from there to the whole Bar. Someone must have swiped it... for pleasure, I guess. There are three charming brunettes on the cover. So what do you say? If I come across it - I'll bring it. If not, then no. Find someone else. That's great then.
I brought you something... The magazine, the right one?! Well, you did say with three brunettes? Yes, they are, my beauties... Wow, what lookers! Have you decided what you want as reward: the stash or military vest? Yes, they are, my beauties... Wow, what lookers! Remind me, how did we agree on the reward? The vest. With mine, you're right, it gets tough in serious fights. I'll swap. Stash at Garbage. Tell me about it. So here's the deal. We were having a heart-to-heart with one soldier and he let slip that he knows where there's a good cache at Garbage. The place is problematic, so the soldier himself didn't dare go there. But the tip is solid, he got it from an experienced stalker. That stalker got caught by a patrol, so he bought himself out with the stash info. Anyway, for you this is - a piece of cake. Remember: look for a backpack behind the hangar, near the pipes, next to the excavator. , . , , . , . , . , . , - . : , . , . , , . , . , . , . , - . : , . You can tell an experienced fighter right away. I respect that! Try it on, adjust it. Yeah... All that's left is to go and take it! Listen, wanted to ask. I flipped through that magazine, just to look at the girls, but somehow didn't notice any recipe there. Yeah... Listen, wanted to ask. I flipped through that magazine, just to look at the girls, but somehow didn't notice any recipe there. Maybe I wrote it down in the wrong magazine?! Just don't suggest now that I look for another one - like with two blondes... 
Sergeant Kitsenko lost a "Playboy" magazine with a recipe written in it. The magazine cover has three charming brunettes. For its return he promises to tell about a good cache at Garbage.
Artifact recipes


Thanks to conducted experiments, the following pattern has been established: if you place a "Sparkler" artifact with absolutely positive characteristics into a "Snow" anomaly (this name is common among stalkers, there is no established scientific definition yet), then this artifact transforms into a new one with completely unique properties! The working name - "Snow" - is given as a reference to the anomaly participating in the transformation process. With sequential presses and touches to specific areas on the artifact's surface (see diagram on the back), there is a release of energy accumulated by the object, as a result of which a %c[UI_orange]"Whirligig" anomaly appears at the location where the artifact was activated!
%c[default]At the same time, "Snow" completely loses its physical shell, turning into chaotic low-intensity radiation. The mechanism of this phenomenon is actively being studied.

 
The "Meat Chunk" artifact is obtained through joint transmutation in a "Springboard" anomaly of four ingredients at once:
 
 dog tail
 tushkano head
 "Slime"
 "Stone Blood"
 
Transformation takes %c[green]7-12 minutes.

 
The "Sparkler" artifact is obtained through joint transmutation in a "Springboard" anomaly of four ingredients at once:
 
 dog tail
 tushkano head
 boar hoof
 "Droplet"
 
Transformation takes %c[green]7-12 minutes.

 
The "Slug" artifact is obtained through joint transmutation in a "Springboard" anomaly of four ingredients at once:
 
 dog tail
 boar hoof
 "Stone Blood"
 "Slime"
 
Transformation takes %c[green]7-12 minutes.

 
The "Crystal" artifact is obtained through joint transmutation in a "Springboard" anomaly of four ingredients at once:
 
 flesh eye
 snork boot
 "Crystal Thorn"
 "Fireball"
 
Transformation takes %c[green]7-12 minutes.

 
The "Urchin" artifact is obtained through joint transmutation in a "Springboard" anomaly of four ingredients at once:
 
 burer paw
 flesh eye
 "Fireball"
 "Crystal Thorn"
 
Transformation takes %c[green]7-12 minutes.

 
The "Dummy" artifact is obtained through joint transmutation in a "Springboard" anomaly of four ingredients at once:
 
 controller hand
 "Droplet" %c[green]entirely positive
%c[default] "Fireball"
 "Crystal"
 
Transformation takes %c[green]7-12 minutes.

 
The "Gravi" artifact is obtained through joint transmutation in a "Vortex" anomaly of four ingredients at once:
 
 boar hoof
 zombie hand

%c[UI_orange]First Level Artifacts [1] 
 
%c[default] The most common artifacts found in the ZONE. They have low value compared to higher level artifacts due to their weakly expressed anomalous properties. They are components for "cooking" first, second, third level artifacts and "Dummy" class artifacts. 
 
 %c[UI_orange]Currently known "recipes" for first level artifacts: 
%c[default] 1. "Sparkler" from "Springboard" 
 2. "Slime" from "Burner" 
 3. "Stone Blood" from "Vortex" 
 4. "Droplet" from "Whirligig" 
 5. "Thorn" from "Fruit Punch" 
 6. "Jellyfish" from "Electra" 
 7. "Wrenched" from "Fruit Punch"
%c[UI_orange]Second Level Artifacts [2] 
 
%c[default] Found less frequently than first level artifacts, but are naturally valued higher. They have more pronounced anomalous properties. Like first level artifacts, they are used in "cooking" other artifacts - third class and "Dummy" class. 
 
 %c[UI_orange]Currently known "recipes" for second level artifacts: 
%c[default] 1. "Meat Chunk" from "Snow" 
 2. "Meat Chunk" from "Springboard" 
 3. "Slug" from "Springboard" 
 4. "Slug" from "Snow" 
 5. "Gravi" from "Vortex" 
 6. "Gravi" from "Burner" 
 7. "Flash" from "Vortex" 
 8. "Flash" from "Burner" 
 9. "Crystal Thorn" from "Whirligig" 
 10. "Crystal Thorn" from "Fruit Punch" 
 11. "Fireball" from "Fruit Punch" 
 12. "Fireball" from "Electra" 
 13. "Stone Flower" from "Electra" 
 14. "Stone Flower" from "Whirligig"
%c[UI_orange]Third Level Artifacts [3] 
 
%c[default] Found even more rarely than first and second level artifacts, they have much more pronounced anomalous properties, accordingly representing greater value for scientists and traders. The peculiarity of artifacts of this level is that they are "born" in a special shell, or as it is also called - a "capsule". Third level artifacts are one of the main components in "cooking" "Dummies". 
 
 %c[UI_orange]Currently known "recipes" for third level artifacts: 
%c[default] 1. "Crystal" from "Springboard" 
 2. "Crystal" from "Fruit Punch" 
 3. "Urchin" from "Springboard" 
 4. "Urchin" from "Snow" 
 5. "Night Star" from "Vortex" 
 6. "Night Star" from "Burner" 
 7. "Soul" from "Vortex" 
 8. "Soul" from "Electra" 
 9. "Moonlight" from "Whirligig" 
 10. "Moonlight" from "Burner" 
 11. "Mica" from "Whirligig" 
 12. "Mica" from "Electra" 
 13. "Goldfish" from "Fruit Punch" 
 14. "Goldfish" from "Electra"
%c[UI_orange]"Dummy" Class Artifacts [D] 
 
%c[default] Finding a "Dummy" class artifact is great luck. Their value is significantly higher than that of previous classes. Like third level artifacts, "Dummy" artifacts are found in their natural shell. Key feature: these artifacts have no negative properties, having at least one, but strongly expressed positive property. They do not participate in "cooking" other artifacts, but can be transformed into "Modificates". 
 
 %c[UI_orange]Currently known "recipes" for "Dummy" class artifacts: 
%c[default] 1. "Pellicle" from "Vortex" 
 2. "Mama's beads" from "Whirligig" 
 3. "Kolobok" from "Fruit Punch" 
 4. "Battery" from "Burner" 
 5. "Spring" from "Electra" 
 6. "Symbion" from "Fruit Punch" 
 7. "Dummy" from "Springboard"
%c[UI_orange]Unique Artifacts [ ] 
 
%c[default] Unique artifacts are not divided into categories, their value is determined based on properties. They are practically never found in the wild nature of the ZONE.

 13. "Gorgon Jellyfish" from "Witch's Jelly"

I heard that some stalkers know how to create such teleports... well, to a specific point, so you could get there... Directed teleportation? You mean that completely unstudied formation of space-time continuum fold? We received some information about cases of affecting this fold with the help of an artifact that stalkers call "Compass". As we found out: the mutual position of individual components of this artifact directly points to the next node of the continuum network. But for this, data on disturbing effects in the area where you need to get to is needed. We have built the necessary equipment into a tube transmission device, now this unit needs to be delivered to an area that we could call receiving... Yes... And where exactly do I need to carry it, and how heavy is this thing of yours? Let's, for starters, try to get data for tuning such an artifact to the nearest quantum network node, at a short distance, say - square 72, or as stalkers call it, "Army Warehouses"...
Try to install the device, it's not heavy - less than 20 kilograms, on a hill, approximately in the central part of this square - on the water tower, in the abandoned village... I think you'll figure it out? Well, I'll try. Twenty kilos? Hmm... I hope this is within your capabilities. I think we can extract mutual benefit from our further communication? In any case - good luck to you! Sorry, professor, I can't right now... Professor Sakharov asked to install the device at Army Warehouses, in the village, on the water tower
I installed the device you gave me. Is everything alright? Yes-yes. The signal is quite stable. Based on the data that the device transmits, it seems possible for me to configure the "Compass". If there's a need and you don't mind such a rare artifact - you're welcome.
We're still studying the materials we receive from there, and based on the results, it will become clear whether tuning to longer distances is possible. Hmm... Strange. We're not receiving a signal. Did you definitely install the device? There, where needed? Please check once more if it's working. Uh... I'll check when I get a chance. How long will you be researching? I can't say exactly, come back later. For now that's all, thank you. So... I carried 20 kilos on my back for a "thank you"? Professor, that's not how business is done... Ah, yes! You're expecting some reward for your labor. Yes, I'd like that. What to give you... You seemed interested in recipes? Write down the recipe for the so-called "Crystal". That's good too... though, I think I already wrote down one like that. Or maybe I'm confusing... Well, that's what there is for now, nothing else.
Have you already studied the data from the device at the Warehouses? Disturbance gradient fluctuations are within acceptable error, correlation shows that even more distant territories are conditionally accessible...
If you're ready to continue these experiments, let's try a longer distance, say, practically to the Zone's perimeter. It would be interesting to know how much the fluctuation deviations of continuum convolution increase in the distance gradient from the epicenter of disturbing anomalous activity. You, I think, have been to the border? As stalkers say, at Cordon? Try to install the device at the highest point of this area. As our available footage shows, this is the railway bridge. On the upper structures, I think it will be fine. Will you take it? Alright. Give me your device... Sorry, professor, but I don't have time for this now. Maybe later... Hmm, indeed, what am I burdening you with?! We're in no hurry, especially since studying the possibility of using spatial anomalies was your initiative. Come back if you change your mind. Here, take it. When you install it, come back, we'll see if there's enough data... Professor Sakharov asked to install the device at Cordon, somewhere on top of the destroyed railway bridge supports
I installed your device at Cordon. Any data? Yes, some data is coming from it. But... I think there's some error here! It turns out that the phase amplitude of spatial continuum remains independent of the distance gradient! Only the temporal constant changes! But... This can't be!
We'll try to derive a general equation of the teleportation field based on these materials. Of course, careful verification is required... I see. And how long will you be "verifying"? I can't say right now. In any case, I think we're in for a revolution in understanding the most fundamental basis of the universe - time. If everything is confirmed, I'll mention you in my report! I'm just thrilled... But couldn't you, instead of mentioning me in a report sometime later, give something substantial right now? How mercantile you are... Will you take medical supplies? Here's a bit. Interested in recipes? Write down the method for obtaining the "Dummy" artifact. Nothing special, but it doesn't hurt. Hmm... Strange. We're not receiving a signal. Did you definitely install the device? Where needed? Please check once more if it's working... Uh-h-h... I'll double-check.
How's the device at Cordon? You wanted to check something else there... The device? Yes-yes, it's working... 
My dear fellow, I understand you probably don't want to risk it again, but... We'd like to get data from a point that directly contacts the Zone's epicenter. 
If possible, could you install similar equipment somewhere in the city of Pripyat? Installation height doesn't matter there. But let's try to get data from the city's central square for more precise positioning. Close to... no, actually. Behind Lenin's monument. Pripyat?! No, professor, that's too much. It's hard enough to get there, let alone drag your contraption... Let's finish our experiments, these two teleportation points are enough for me, and for your scientific report you can find someone else. Too bad, I thought we worked well together. Well, we'll try to find a new... volunteer.
Professor, will you help me set up the teleporter? Why not? However, you're a risky person... Where would you like to get to? Wouldn't be bad to end up at the Army Warehouses... To Cordon. Got some business there. Ah, square 72! We have the data, in principle. Well, we can do it now.
Do you have an anomalous formation of series 896? They also call it "Compass". Yes, I have it. Don't have one... Thought you'd have it. Well then, calibrating all parameters takes time, and time, as you know, is money... And how much will I owe you? We've been dealing with each other for some time now. I think donating any simple artifact for research purposes would compensate for the equipment time spent. Alright, agreed, I'll donate... Here's the "Compass" too. Nah, I'll just walk there on foot... Excellent. Please wait about fifteen minutes... We'll model the data in the program and adjust the crystal formations of this artifact based on the results. Good. Go ahead and adjust it. Cordon? The Zone's outskirts... That's possible.
Give me your "Compass". Do you have it? Here it is, my precious... Like a toy. And I thought you had one... We'll have to redirect some computing power for calculations. It's quite costly. We'll need to justify these expenses with solid arguments later... And what kind of "argument" would satisfy you? In this case, any simple artifact would suffice. We can put it through the reports as necessary research. Good. Here's a simple artifact and the "Compass". Nah, I'll just walk there on foot... You'll have to wait a bit while our computer performs the necessary calculations. Ten minutes, maybe twenty. Alright, I'll wait.
What about the "Compass" calibration? Is it ready? You need to be more patient, young man. This operation requires very precise calculations. So please wait. We managed to align the structural elements on the artifact to the correct position. The teleportation point has been set with precision... well, I'll spare you the details you don't need. Everything is ready. Though in your position I wouldn't risk using such unproven methods... Alright, alright, I'll wait... I've had to risk myself with more serious things. Your choice. The anomalous formation of the nearest node, according to latest data, hasn't changed its location - it's still there, on the islet in the swamp, behind our bunker. Don't forget to activate the calibrated artifact!
Listen, you've been here for a while now, right? Heard about teleporting? Well not that long... But not just since yesterday either. Not only heard about teleports, but even met a guy who said he could set one up himself. He even showed me how it's done, but it's very complicated. And expensive. You need to use a very good artifact. And know a specific location, and account for other factors - it's a whole science. For us stalkers, it's not worth it. Easier to just walk quietly where you need to go than blow a whole fortune in artifacts. Wait, wait! You're saying you can "configure" a teleporter? Yes, you can... But like I said - you need to know how. Otherwise you might "fly" so far that no one will ever find you. And knowledge costs money... Yeah, I figured! And how much should I pay you? Whoa, you got all excited... First you need maps of the place where you want to set up the teleporter. Not regular ones, but detailed geological-seismological maps...
If we can find those, then we can talk about something... And where might such maps be found? Well, when they built the underground laboratories, they usually made such detailed maps. Maybe something survived. I don't know. I didn't really need them, but if you're interested - you're the one who should look for them. Alright, the maps are clear. But where do you already know how to get to? You do know some places, right? Uh-h-h... Yes. I know a couple places. For example, I've set up one to the Swamp. To the Gut too... But that's close by. If I had maps, I could calculate farther distances. To the Warehouses, for example, or somewhere else. So if you're interested, you need to go underground. There might be the information we need. In the laboratories? It's tempting, of course, but dangerous there. I'll think about it. Ah, screw it... I'll manage for now. It's dangerous here too. Think it over. 
Fanatic says he can set up a teleporter for jumping from Cordon to the Army Warehouses. For this, he needs to find detailed geological-seismological maps somewhere in the laboratories
I found a laptop in... a basement, seems to still be working. Probably maps could be there too... What kind of maps? Did you at least check? How can I check? See for yourself. Nah, wait, I'll come back again. Hmm... It even turns on, would you look at that! Yeah, there are maps! Right! I'll consult with the guys here, and you come back tomorrow. Maybe something will work out. Go ahead and consult, I'll wait.
So what's in the laptop? Can we set up a teleporter somewhere else? Yeah, me and the guys thought about it, seems like there's geological survey data in that laptop. I think it's the Army Warehouses, you know, where the Freedomers hang out. Worth a try. But you need a "Compass" artifact... Heard of such a thing? Wait up! This ain't simple stuff! It'll smear you between here and nowhere - you'll be the one to blame then... You gotta think! Yeah-yeah, think away, I'll wait... "Compass"? Well yeah. So what? Can I fly? Well... Kinda like that... On this "Compass" there are little thingies, moving them in a special way you can roughly determine where it'll take you... So yeah - everything seems normal.
Well, since you worked so hard - write down this useful recipe.
Help me use the teleporter... Well, I see you don't value your life much. And where are you headed? To the Warehouses, let's see how things are there... To the Swamp. Got business there... To the Gut, or I'll have to walk there! To create the teleporter we need a "Compass".
You got one? Yes, I have one... Hmm, no. Don't have one... Hand it over... The guys here help me with calculations, gotta thank them somehow... Alright, how much do you need? Money's dust. Give me an artifact. A simple one. Deal, here's an artifact. Man, you guys got some appetite, I'll walk there myself. Good. We'll calibrate the "Compass". Come back in about ten minutes. You'll pick it up. Uh-huh, get to work. Calibration requires a "Compass".
You got one? Yes, I have one... Hmm, no. Don't have one... Hand it over... The guys here help me with calculations, gotta thank them somehow... Alright, how much do you need? Keep your wooden ones. Give me an artifact. A simple one. Deal, here's an artifact. Man, you guys got some appetite, I'll walk there myself. Good. We'll calibrate your "Compass". Come back in about ten minutes. You'll pick it up. Uh-huh, get to work. Remember the "Compass"?
You got it with you? Yeah-yeah. I got it... Hmm, no. Don't have a "Compass"... Gotta pay for the calculations. To the guys... Pay, pay. Same thing all the time. How much? Minimum price - a simple little artifact. Alright. Deal, here's an artifact... No way. I'd rather take a nice walk than give up an artifact! While we're calibrating your "Compass", take a walk, rest up. Come back in about fifteen minutes... You'll pick it up. Alright, I'll rest for a while.
So what about the "Compass" calibration? Ready? Wait up! What are you, some kind of hothead or what... Huh? You'll get stuck in a rock, then you'll be the one to blame! Well it's ready now. Are you completely nuts? The odds are 50-50! Remember how to use it? Over there in the ravine, in the fog, there's this orb - semi-transparent. Activate the calibrated "Compass" on your belt and step into it. Yeah. Maybe you'll come back. Alright, alright, I'll wait... Ah come on, we'll figure it out! If we're alive - we won't die! Well, see for yourself. Take it. Uh-h-h...

Haven't brought anything yet, but wait, I'll be quick. Here's a fresh "Soul", pure as a baby's.
You offer interesting information. Can I ask you to cook an artifact - "Mica", for example? "Mica"? Actually, I rarely do this. Well... I'll cook it for you in exchange for another artifact. I'm waiting for someone, he should come by. Come back later, we'll discuss it. Don't worry about payment. For now, here are the components for cooking. I need to look for a few more things for cooking. Components delivered and you can go, don't hover around here, I still have lots of meetings with important people. Come back in a couple hours. I'll come by, of course. Later. Alright, I'll take a walk. Just don't forget about my business. Is the "Mica" ready, can I pick it up? It's ready, but I work like this - first payment, then goods. I told you - don't hover around. A bit later, I haven't forgotten about you. Just checking, just a reminder, you never know... Of course. Here's the payment. Can't do it the other way around? Alright, I'll bring something now. Here's the "Mica". You're free to go.
About that little recipe... Could you help me make a "Goldfish" from it? I thought you'd already figured out what's what yourself. Alright, I'll make it. I'll help, but not right now. Come back after some time. I've already found all the stuff and artifacts. Just need to cook it. I haven't found everything yet, but it won't take long. I'll be back soon. Judging by the recipe, I have everything that's needed. I'm busy right now... come back in a couple hours, it'll be ready. And I wouldn't mind getting an artifact for my efforts too. Alright, no problem. I thought you'd start right away. Fine, I can wait a couple hours. Here I am, came for the "Goldfish". Good that you came. And you brought me an artifact, of course? You came too early. It needs to cook a bit more. I'll wait. But the recipe said it would cook faster. Brought it, of course. Take it. No, I didn't bring it, slipped my mind. Hold on, I'll be right back. Good trade. Here's your "Goldfish", use it well.
Greetings. I need help cooking "Moonlight". Will you help? What times we live in. A private asking a superior to cook something. Alright, don't worry, soldier, I'll cook it... I don't have the desire to mess with this right now. Maybe later. Here, all the ingredients. Should be just right. I'll find all the ingredients and bring them. Leave everything here. I'm not gonna drop everything right now and run off to cook. Come back in a couple hours, maybe I'll manage by then. That'll give you just enough time to find an artifact for me too. Well later it is then. I'll come back. Understood. Your business is more important, but just look, if you took it on, then finish it. Is the "Moonlight" ready, or did I come too early? It's ready, perfect timing. You brought the artifact? Of course, too early. Take a walk for a bit more. I'll take a walk. Thought it was ready already. I brought it, here's your artifact. I didn't bring it, thought I'd bring it later. Well, if you need it now, I'll be right back. Here you go, soldier, "Moonlight". What would you do without me...
Ivar, I like how you cook different artifacts. Cook me a "Goldfish". I cook with my conscience. My cooking - quality guaranteed. I can cook for you too. I cook well, that's why I got plenty of orders. I'm working on one order right now. Once I'm free, maybe I'll work on yours. Yeah, cook it. Here, I got everything needed for this. You'll cook it? Then I'll gather everything needed and come to you right away. Let's do it. Alright, now take a walk. Quality cooking is a delicate matter, requires concentration, so don't disturb me. You'll get your fish... well, you know my condition. Well then I'll drop by later when you're more free. I know, an artifact. I don't doubt your abilities. Cook away, and I'll step aside. Is my fish cooked? I made fish soup from your fish... It's a joke, don't get worked up. Here it is, give me the artifact. Not yet, gotta let it sit a bit to be sure. Alright, if patience is required for quality, I'll wait. Take it, for a good person, anything you want. Eh... Don't have it with me. I'll bring it soon. The fish turned out excellent, like I cooked it for myself. Take it.
I got business with you. Don't need information, need help. Cook me a "Dummy". It's not really my line of work... Well alright, not for free though, you understand. I got an important meeting. Can't deal with you right now. Come back later, we'll talk. Thanks. Here, take all the spare parts for the "Dummy", I mean the components for cooking. You'll take it on? Then I'll be quick - just gather everything that's needed. I'll be fast as a fly, you wait. Now step back and don't loom around. I accepted the order, means there'll be a product, but not right away - in about two hours. Won't remind you about payment, you should know yourself. You always got meetings... I'll come back later. Don't need to remind me. I remember, one artifact. How's the "Dummy" coming along, can I take it? It's ready. Maybe you'll pay first, then take it? That'd be more proper. Not yet, things ain't as quick as you'd like. Should be ready by now... I'll be back soon. Of course, "money up front". Here's the artifact. You'll get your payment soon. Wait a bit. Could've brought something better... Alright, take your "Dummy".
Professor, help me make a "Pellicle". I have everything that's needed. You have everything? Then what's the difficulty, it's not hard to prepare. Give me your ingredients, I'll make it for you. Try it yourself, I'm busy right now. If you can't manage, come back a bit later, I'll help. Here they are. Everything as written. I was wrong, I don't have everything yet. What a leaky head I have. I'll be back soon. So, what do you have here? Ah, everything's suitable. I'll start the process, and I'll ask you to find any simple artifact as a token of gratitude. You'll have enough time before the process finishes. I already tried. Better I come to you again, later. The process is started! Excellent, my gratitude is secured. Has the cooking process finished? It didn't end, it completed. Awkward to remind you... about the promised gratitude. Not yet. But soon. Taking a while. I'll come back again. Don't need to remind me. I said I'd show gratitude, so here's your artifact. Oh, good that you reminded me... I feel awkward myself. I'll bring it now. . "".
Ivar, I like your cooking products, cook me "Mama's beads". You flatter me. Come on then, I'll cook it, bring everything that's needed. I'll cook it, of course, just later. Come back in some time. I already got everything, just need to cook it. Here you go. Right now, I'll find everything needed and bring it. Beads, little beads... They'll be ready in about two hours. You can find some artifact meanwhile. I'm just hinting... I'll come back later. Even without a hint it's clear, what am I, a first-timer or something. How are the "Beads", ready? I prepared them... Now you prepare the artifact. No, it's too early. Quality "Beads" need to simmer longer. Well simmer them, quality is what matters. Here's payment for the work. Already running, it'll be soon. And here are "Mama's beads". Beautiful! Almost jewelry work.
Do you cook to order? I need a "Kolobok", cook me one. To order only for certain people. Well for you, of course, I'll cook it. I'll definitely cook it, but a bit later. Here, I got all the components. I'll be back soon, just need to gather everything that's needed. A good "Kolobok" doesn't cook in five minutes, so you can go clear your head for an hour or two. By the way, bring something for the work. I'll come later, don't forget what you promised. No question, I'll bring an artifact. Good work should be paid for. How's the "Kolobok"? I think it's time already. You came at just the right time. Got the artifact with you? No, not time yet. Take a little walk. And I thought it was time... Got it with me. Here, take it. No, don't have it with me, wait, I'll be right back... Here's the "Kolobok". Voil?!
I need a "Spring", and I know the recipe, but I can't make it. Help me. What would you do without me? Come on, give me the spare parts for your spring. Later... Not now. Spare parts? Oh, components - here they are. Haven't found everything yet. I won't be long, wait. So, soldier, go do some business meanwhile - find me an artifact. You got two hours at your disposal. Alright, I'll come later. Plenty of time to even get some sleep. How's my "Spring"? I'm here for it. The "Spring" is good. Did you bring me an artifact? You came too early. Go get some more sleep. And I thought it was ready... You offend me, chief. What's there to talk about... No, but I'll bring it, wait. Take the "Spring", use it well.
Hey there, Wolf, moved to the Warehouses? And what about your young guys? The young guys won't be left without supervision, don't worry. There's someone to replace me. 
Marked One, you run around the Zone back and forth, haven't you met Petruha? Petruha? You two seemed to be close friends. You see, Marked One, we had a falling out during our last meeting. I got one idea where he might've gone, but it needs checking. How about you? What "how about"? Wolf, can you be more specific? More specific? If you happen to end up at Forgotten Village, ask around if this dove showed up there. If you meet him yourself - don't mention our conversation or my interest in his person. Now specific enough? Fair enough. I'll look into it when I'm at the village. But you understand, I'm not promising anything.
I'm here on business. I saw Petruha at Forgotten Village. You saw him?! So how is he there? He's sitting with some stalkers, sipping vodka, complaining about his fate. Ah... Well, that's his favorite song lately when he's drunk. The guy's burned out, it seems. The Zone's grown stale for him. Don't tell me about his hardships. What's Petruha up to? Drinking his life away or does he have some interest there? He's looking for a stash. Says once he finds it, the sweet life will begin for him. So far though, without much success. He's looking for your stash, by the way. Mine?! Didn't think he'd dare to do such a thing... And anyway, what gave him the idea that I stashed my loot at Forgotten Village? Wolf, you asked me to find out about Petruha, I found out. What and why he's searching there is none of my business. I'll drop by later, maybe we'll discuss something. Really none of your business? Alright, thanks anyway. Come by if you change your mind. We'll chat. We'll definitely chat.
Remember the conversation about Forgotten Village? Can't complain about my memory. Did you find out anything else about Petruha or...? Exactly that "or", Wolf. I found at the Village - purely by accident - an inconspicuous backpack in the outhouse. Inside was a note, meant for Petruha, as I understand. About your carefree childhood, your mother the teacher, troublesome students.... That got my interest and I decided to seriously search the area. Soon I found your second stash, the real one. With a container and another note for Petruha. You wanted to play it safe, since you're offering him a "truce" there? Thought he'd instantly forget everything and come running here with his tongue hanging out to drag your loot? Maybe he would've taken the bait, fool. What's it to you? Who is he to you, brother or in-law? I just can't figure out: why did you drag your ass all the way here to tell me all this? Come to confess that you had your eye on someone else's stuff? Well, I don't absolve sins - that's for Diodor. I can only put a bullet in your forehead for ratting. Or maybe you want to shame me into something? You'd better hold off on the threats, I'm not Petruha and I'm not some green rookie, so don't lean on me with your voice. And don't make me out to be a rat. As if everyone here is perfectly righteous. At Cordon, in the village, how many stalkers have your "problem" boys ripped off? They sit around all day, shooting the shit, eating, drinking... On what money? Or didn't you have a clue what your young punks were up to? Marked One, don't get in my face and stick your tongue where the sun don't shine. You found my stash, so count yourself lucky and get lost... before things get ugly. Hold on, don't get heated... I already told you I don't do ratting. Your stashes at the Village were, honestly speaking, shit out of luck. It's actually surprising that nobody managed to stumble on them before me. I've stashed your valuables somewhere safe for now, but I'm ready to return everything if you promise to rein in your scumbags at Cordon. It ain't human, after all. Consider it instead of payment. But if you share some useful information, I'd be grateful. You know what interests me. So that's how it is? Alright, consider we have a deal. Bring me my artifacts, and grab that note too. I don't want Petruha to "accidentally" read it later. If you haven't tossed it already. Wait up, I'll be quick.
Brought your treasures, Wolf. You brought them? I was honestly having doubts. Who knows what you were in your past life. I'll keep my word, the young guys from Cordon will get a talking-to today. I just don't know what "useful" thing I could tell you. Since you found my stash, I'll tell you, I suppose, where that container with artifacts came from. I'm thinking maybe both of us can profit from this.
There was this stalker who'd visit Cordon village periodically, one of those loners who treads the Zone solo. Never stayed long: would drop off goods to Sidorovich and immediately fuck off. No "hello" or "goodbye" to you. Plenty of such folk visit our old rogue benefactor. Always closer to nightfall. Dark people, but they don't bother the youngsters, keep order, throw the "diesel man" a coin or two. So one time this stalker asked permission to spend the night in our cellar. Vergas' "barometer" had already triggered that evening, an emission was forecasted for the night. And apparently it wasn't convenient for him to split. So your boys... fleeced him then? Listen, don't start that shit again, yeah? Alright, alright, I'm quiet. Continue. Evening came, and as usual, we sat by the fire. Had some drinks, snacks, bitched about our lives. This stalker didn't refuse the hospitality, even put some of his own stuff on the table. Though he didn't join the general conversation, just chewed and drank quietly. Closer to night I checked the posts, settled down the youngsters, sent them off to their mattresses, and we were left alone. He kept quiet, and I didn't pry with questions. We smoked and knocked back shots. That's clear, let's get to the point already. Don't interrupt... 
Then the Emission hit. I casually headed to the cellar, but this guy just sits there, doesn't budge. Well, I think, he's slow from the booze, but why rush him - the shelter's two steps away, he'll make it. But no, he tilted his head to the sky and sits there. I looked from the basement: everything's shaking like hell, and he's sitting. His black eyes bulging at the sky... I went back down to the cellar, who knows how many nutjobs the Zone has spawned, one more, one less. When the apocalypse ended, I climbed out, and he's knocking back a shot and eating sausage. Of course, I immediately grabbed my gun - it's not every day you meet a living zombie in the village. But no, he looked the same as before. Thoughtful gaze, human appearance. I've had to weather emissions in open fields too. At Cordon it doesn't hit too hard, but you still walk around like you got the plague for half a day. But you couldn't tell with him. That something wasn't clean here immediately came to mind. Out of the corner of my eye I spotted an unusual artifact on his belt, never had to see such a thing before. And believe me, Marked One, I've seen plenty of unusual shit. But this stalker managed to surprise me. Hey Wolf, you sure you didn't just imagine all this while drunk? Interrupt again with your "smart" comments, and that's where the story ends. Listen on... 
I say to the stalker: "What's with these experiments, uncle, and in a crowded place too? The people here are weak-nerved, not hardened by the Zone. Such a show is contraindicated for them. If life has gotten boring, a bullet will settle everything quickly, and if you want to suffer before death, then go to Radar. They'll cook your brains into jelly real quick there. Walk through the forest, moo around, maybe someone will hear and put you out of your misery." And he just grins. Fucking magician, homegrown sorcerer. Fine, I say: "If you're a master at pulling such tricks, share your secret. It's not a military secret. And I can put up a couple of wonderful things in exchange." 
Surprisingly - he agreed to trade, apparently our hospitality hit the spot, and the vodka did its job. We settled on a price. Didn't take much. He gave me a set of artifacts, the very same ones from the container, and attached a recipe to them. The artifact made from them gives good protection from all kinds of telepathy. Though, as luck would have it, in that emission my PDA burned out, I wrote the recipe on paper, and then somewhere I successfully lost... misplaced it, basically. I stashed the artifacts at Forgotten Village for the time being, until I get the recipe again. Only it happened that you found my stash earlier. Interesting. Such an artifact would come in really handy for me, especially when I'm planning to head further North. There, from what I've heard, your brains boil instantly without good protection. Holy shit, I actually know that recipe. The artifact is called "Symbion", right? I was hoping that maybe you know that recipe. The artifacts, as you can see, are useful, but what to do with them... Can't just throw them randomly into every anomaly you come across. That piece of paper with the recipe, I kind of didn't use it for hygienic purposes by mistake, or maybe I just dropped it somewhere accidentally. You, Marked One, here's the thing... If you happen to find out the recipe, don't be lazy to find me. I'm not promising mountains of gold, but you'll get a tip about decent loot. Yeah I don't remember, maybe it is. Will you share the recipe? I'll give you a tip about decent loot. True, you'll have to trek further north for it, but you need to go to those parts anyway. Agreed? Alright, I'll keep you in mind. But now - time for me to go. Take your valuables. And here's the note too, as you asked. Alright, I'll keep you in mind. But now - time for me to go. Take your valuables. I couldn't find that note. Looks like I already managed to toss it, don't blame me. Hold on, let's first deal with your artifacts. Here, take them, everything's accounted for. And here's the note, as you asked. Hold on, let's first deal with your artifacts. Here, take them, everything's accounted for. I couldn't find that note. Looks like I already managed to toss it, don't blame me. I'm not offering you anything, and there's really nothing to talk about. No recipe and that's it. If you find any information about this matter yourself, then come see me. But for now, it is what it is. Well, thanks for returning the artifacts. And here, take some ammo from me, it'll come in handy. Well, everything's in place. You can keep the container and here's some ammo from me, it'll come in handy. And I'm treating you separately for the note. Thanks. The main thing for me is the artifacts. And the note... fuck it! I just hope you won't go blabbering to Petruha about this whole story. Yeah, you can keep the container and here's some ammo from me, it'll come in handy.
About that recipe for the telepathy protection artifact... You know one? Where from, if it's not a secret? I was in a former laboratory, in Dark Valley, that's where I happened to learn about it. How? I heard all entrances to it are sealed shut. Turns out, not so shut after all. Basically, I was crawling around there on my own business, and stumbled on it by accident, you could say. But still, what got you to go to that laboratory? What business could an ordinary stalker have there? Smart people avoid even the blocked entrances by taking the tenth road around. They said darkness lives there, death lives there. That's just how it worked out. I'd prefer not to go into details. And the bony one is, like, my relative or godmother. I fell from her truck. You know that. Yeah... when you showed up in the village, you looked exactly like you'd been taken down from a cross. People say about such folk: "they'd look better laid in a coffin". And how I showed up, do you remember? Well... you ask the Doctor, he was putting you back into human shape, he'll answer. I was away at the time. You didn't finish about the recipe... Right. This artifact is called "Symbion", cooked for about 10 minutes in "Fruit Punch" from that set you had. Really does protect well against psi-influence. By the way, one thought keeps nagging me: how did that stalker you told me about know all this? I'm thinking you knew him even before that incident. Or am I wrong? Marked One, did you come to share the recipe or conduct an interrogation? Who knows where he learned it from, maybe he figured it out through trial and error himself. Besides, that guy hasn't shown up at Cordon for a couple months now. It's all the same here: either dead, or he got out of the Zone. Alright, my head's already stuffed with riddles as it is. What about our deal? As promised, I'm giving you a tip about one interesting stash, it's in Red Forest. Since your road lies north, you'll definitely be in those parts, won't pass it by. Here are the coordinates, I'll mark it on your PDA now. Just better try to remember the terrain right away. These pieces of shit glitch sometimes. It happens that the marker can disappear. Or the damn device stops working altogether. Alright. I'll be going, see you around.
Still telling jokes? Marked One, listen, how are you on free time? Could you help us solve one problem? If you have the time and desire, of course. Problems? I'm not a scientist, what use am I to science? Or are you inviting me to be a test subject? I still want to live! No-no, friend, you misunderstood everything a bit. Yeah, understanding you eggheads is quite the problem. What do you want? You see... we have several measurement complexes deployed in different locations. Unfortunately, the remote radio channel is extremely unstable, and we can't receive the necessary information for long periods. We need to deliver cards with accumulated data from recorders located in various parts of the Zone. I'm asking you to make a voyage there and extract the cards with accumulated material. I guarantee a good reward. And you, who suffered in the unequal battle with mercenaries, are in no shape now, you have stress? Marked One, understand me correctly too. Right now it's really inconvenient for me and my assistants to leave Yantar for long. There's one deal coming up, and our counterpart in this matter should appear any day now. The deal will be profitable for you too, by the way. If everything goes well and, as they say, the parties come to a consensus, then subsequently, after completing all the work with the recorders, I would help you with artifact exchange. Namely: trading one second-level artifact for three random first-level ones, from those that will be at hand. Or for two specific ones, your choice, but then your artifact must be in excellent condition and no lower than third grade. Think about it, who else in the Zone will offer you such fantastic terms? Small business, everything's clear with you guys. And what will you tell Sakharov? How will you explain to him where you got the data when you've been sitting at Yantar the whole time? Life's realities are such that man cannot live by bread alone. Alas. Especially when there's an opportunity to diversify the menu a bit, like... add cheese and butter to the bread. You, I think, see everything yourself - scientific activity is not the professor's only income. He's far from an altruist. Artifact exchange for equipment, how to put it right... well, you get it. The main thing is results. So there won't be any friction between you. I really wouldn't want to find myself on the front line of your feud. And I'd like to discuss the payment question right away. What do you offer? I see, Marked One, you have an entrepreneurial streak in you. You can't help but become enterprising here. One thing they only trade at Swamp, another can only be found at Yantar, the third - devil knows where... So let's talk about Swamp. The first four recorders are located right there. The area is familiar to you, I hope. Four towers are active there, there shouldn't be problems with extracting the cards. Upon completion of the work you'll get a recipe for one good modificate and medicines. You taking it? Recipe, medicine, exchange... And is it worth it? The job's completely trivial, well, trivial for you. Payment's good, come by, don't drag it out. I'll think about it, other business has piled up for now. Maybe later.
I'm here about the cards from the recorders at Swamp. The offer still stands? Made up your mind? I'm just curious, I'm not ready yet for scientific exploits. At least outline where and what to look for. Swamp is big. Then let's get to business. I'll mark the complex locations on your PDA. Oh, and if possible, don't drag this out - consider the work urgent. It's been a month without a single stable communication session with that area, and as a result we have firewood prices from the Arctic instead of observation data. I'll try not to take long.
Job's done, science. What job? What are you talking about? Brought the cards from the recorders at Swamp, the data's there.
Hey, where are you reaching? First the recipe, the reward - you promised! Ah, well done, Marked One! Sorry, got completely wound up. I've uploaded the recipe to your PDA. Some medicine too, with what we have on hand. Good enough? Hmm. Not bad. What's next? About the other recorders, come by a bit later. In about ten minutes. Need to cross-check the data. I'll drop by Sakharov for now.
Kruglov, what about the data, has it been clarified? Right. We need to retrieve cards with accumulated data from complexes in the so-called "Foggy Thicket". According to latest reports, three installations are still working there. You up for it? Same reward - recipe and medicine. Foggy Thicket, you say... Not the most pleasant place, from what I've been told. Agreed, here's the PDA - mark the search area. I'm just curious, I'm not ready yet for scientific exploits. Excellent, here, here and here. But remember - we need the cards soon: then a new measurement cycle will begin and the collected parametric data will become obsolete. Got it, I'll try not to drag it out.
Hey, science! Got the cards from the devices in Foggy Thicket. Where's my recipe? Hope it'll be something worthwhile, not like last time. Don't doubt it - it'll come in handy. Give me the PDA, I'll upload the recipe. Let's see your "thing". And the rest? We had a deal. Ah, yes, sorry, I forgot. You're being a rogue, got a taste for trading? There's one more place, a pair of recorders working in Red Forest. Will you take it on? I'll think about it.
Shall we continue our scientific exploits? I'm talking about the cards from the recorders. Marked One, you're not planning to take a stroll to Zone 65 in the near future? "Red Forest", if you will. Red Forest? From what veteran stalkers told me, Red Forest isn't some park for recreation where you "take a stroll". You won't get by with just a recipe and a couple medkits here. All the Zone's fauna gathered in one place there. Jaws wide open, just waiting for someone to devour. Our deal is still on, of course, but you understand - you might not come back from there at all. And as usual, you need it urgent and fast? I'm just curious, I'm not ready yet for scientific exploits. Good. If you complete this assignment, you'll get a "salary raise" in the form of a very rare artifact. And I think the exchange matter will finally be resolved. As they say - "the client has matured". I'm counting on your honesty. Excellent, so we have a deal. The recorders are located here and here. But remember - we need the cards as soon as possible, because then a new measurement cycle will begin, and the collected parametric data will become obsolete. I remember, I remember. I'll try not to drag it out.
Hey, science! Here are your cards from Red Forest, now give me my recipe, bonus and whatever else... what's due to me. I'm pretty worn out. Give me the PDA, I'll upload the recipe. And the rest? Where's the "salary raise"? We had a deal. And by the way, what about the exchange? When will it be resolved? You hurt my feelings, Marked One. The first batch for exchange is already ready. So if you have second-level artifacts, you're welcome to come. And this is a separate token of gratitude from all of us. That's better. If I have extra artifacts I'll come by.
Recorder installation area Throw an artifact into an anomaly in the "Tesla" zone Throw an artifact into an anomaly in the District Center Throw an artifact into an anomaly at Radar Receive a call from Swan the Connector Talk to the Connector in Pripyat
